title: Sr. Data Engineer (Remote, Eastern Brazil)
description:
VTRAC Consulting Corporation

Intelligent Solutions


Thank you for applying to VTRAC opportunities. Please e-mail your resume as an MS-WORD document in confidence Subject: Sr. Data Engineer, Attention: or call: (647) 254-0904


Position #: 251172-B

Position: Sr. Data Engineer

Position Type: Contract

No. of Positions: 1

Location: Remote


Description:

An exciting opportunity for a skilled Data Engineer to join our team and help us build and maintain our data infrastructure. As a Sr. Data Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining large-scale data systems, including data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes. You will work closely with data architects, data scientists, and other stakeholders to ensure that our data systems meet the needs of our business.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, build, and maintain large-scale data systems, including data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes
  • Work with data architects to design and implement data models and data architectures
  • Collaborate with data scientists to develop and deploy machine learning models and data products
  • Develop and maintain data pipelines using tools such as Apache Beam, Apache Spark, and AWS Glue
  • Design and implement data warehouses using tools such as Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, and Snowflake
  • Develop and maintain data lakes using tools such as Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, and Amazon S3
  • Ensure data quality and integrity by developing and implementing data validation and data cleansing processes
  • Collaborate with other teams to ensure that data systems meet the needs of the business
  • Stay up-to-date with new technologies and trends in data engineering and make recommendations for adoption


Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of experience in data engineering or a related field
  • 8+ years of experience with programming languages such as Python, Java, and Scala
  • 4+ years of experience with data modeling and data architecture
  • 4+ years of experience with data engineering tools such as Apache Beam, Apache Spark, AWS Glue, Amazon Redshift, Google BigQuery, and Snowflake
  • Strong experience with data warehousing and data lakes
  • Strong experience with data validation and data cleansing
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Nice to Have:

  • Experience with machine learning and data science
  • Experience with cloud-based data platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure
  • Experience with containerization using Docker and Kubernetes
  • Experience with agile development methodologies such as Scrum or Kanban
  • Experience with data governance and data security


We thank all candidates in advance. Only selected candidates for interviews will be contacted. For other exciting opportunities, please visit us at . VTRAC is an equal-opportunity employer.



Toronto. Houston. New York. Palo Alto.

title: Sourcer Analyst ‚Äì VAGA AFIRMATIVA PCD
description:
Job Title: Sourcer Analyst ‚Äì Exclusive PWD

This is an affirmative position exclusive to persons PCD in Brazil.

Location: Remote (Brazil)

Employment Type: Contract


About the Role

We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Sourcing Analyst to join our recruitment team in the HR and talent acquisition sector. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, attracting, and engaging potential candidates through various sourcing strategies. You will also support internal recruitment operations by assisting with sourcing, CV formatting, interview scheduling, and documentation.


Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Use proactive sourcing strategies to identify active and passive candidates

‚Ä¢ Generate interest in open roles and build a strong talent pipeline

‚Ä¢ Conduct initial candidate screenings and collaborate with recruiters

‚Ä¢ Focus on hard-to-fill and technical roles

‚Ä¢ Perform market analysis and salary benchmarking

‚Ä¢ Maintain and update internal recruitment documentation

‚Ä¢ Assist with CV formatting and interview scheduling


Requirements

‚Ä¢ Skilled in Boolean search techniques

‚Ä¢ Experience with candidate relationship management (CRM) systems

‚Ä¢ Strong communication and research abilities

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience in sourcing or recruitment

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Administration, Human Resources, or related fields


Preferred Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Experience sourcing for technical or niche roles

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS)

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, remote environment

English Intermediate


Who We Are

Talent where you need it, when you need it!

SGF Global is a leading specialized talent solutions provider dedicated to connecting highly qualified professionals with opportunities across multiple sectors. We offer contract, temporary, and permanent hiring solutions for roles in technology, finance and accounting, engineering, marketing and creative, legal services, administrative and customer support, energy, oil and gas, telecommunications, manufacturing, aerospace, life sciences, mining, and utilities.

At SGF Global, we work to put you in the best position to succeed. We provide access to top-tier positions, competitive compensation, attractive benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity, anytime‚Äîeven on the go.

About Olly Olly

Ready to roll up your sleeves and help transform local marketing forever? At Olly Olly, we‚Äôre blending technology and real-world expertise to empower businesses across the U.S. like never before.


We believe small businesses are the backbone of our economy. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre on a mission to provide them with tools, strategies, and insights that help them rank higher, generate high-quality leads, get calls and reviews, and, above all, grow sustainably without the hassle.


The Olly Olly platform complements our hands-on service perfectly: it‚Äôs no-nonsense, easy-to-use software that helps local businesses streamline operations and contact management, drive leads, stabilize cash flow, and maximize revenue with minimal effort so they can reclaim their time to focus on what they do best.


Our Vision

We aim to be the ultimate all-in-one platform for small business growth, allowing owners to manage every part of their business efficiently and effortlessly.


Our journey began as an agency, and we‚Äôve already helped thousands of clients succeed. Now, we‚Äôre embracing an exciting new chapter: becoming a SaaS-first company. By combining hard-earned human expertise with AI and automation, we‚Äôre creating affordable solutions that give business owners peace of mind while driving measurable success.

title: Senior Software (Video) Engineer
description:
About Redflag AI

Redflag AI is redefining the future of content protection. Our proprietary Cyclops system embeds invisible, robust watermarks into live and on-demand content, enabling detection and takedown of pirated media in near real time. We serve top-tier content owners including sports leagues, streamers, and broadcasters.

This is a unique opportunity to work on low-level watermarking systems, real-time video pipelines, and CDN edge enforcement infrastructure.


Role Overview

We‚Äôre hiring a Senior Engineer to help advance the Cyclops watermarking platform. This involves working in C/C++, Python, and collaborating with CDN partners to deploy lightweight modulation algorithms directly at the edge. Familiarity with video codecs, HLS/DASH, and performance-optimized systems is essential.


Key Responsibilities

  • Design and optimize watermarking modules written in C/C++ for real-time video processing
  • Work with Python services to manage fingerprint instructions and watermark IDs
  • Integrate watermarking pipelines with CDNs like Fastly, Akamai, and Cloudflare
  • Develop methods for embedding and verifying imperceptible video modulations at scale
  • Coordinate with the detection team to validate watermark robustness post-compression
  • Write efficient, cross-platform code that performs under strict performance constraints
  • Lead technical discussions on watermarking standards and adversarial defense strategies


Requirements

  • 5+ years of systems programming experience in C/C++
  • Understanding of H.264/H.265 codecs, GOP structures, and video encoding/decoding pipelines (preferable)
  • Experience with CDNs and edge deployment (e.g., WASM, VCL, Varnish)
  • Strong scripting in Python for glue code, control flows, and testing frameworks
  • Knowledge of video streaming protocols such as HLS, DASH, and RTMP
  • Strong debugging and optimization skills for performance-critical systems


Bonus Skills

  • Familiarity with perceptual hashing and fingerprinting techniques
  • Experience with DRM, forensic watermarking, or broadcast compliance tools
  • Contributions to open-source multimedia libraries (e.g., FFmpeg, GStreamer)
  • GPU programming (CUDA/OpenCL) for real-time video processing

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
Job Title: Linux Administrator (Night Shift)

Location: Remote (EST Hours: 11 PM - 8 AM)


Our client is seeking an experienced Linux Administrator to join their team. This role is ideal for professionals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and have a strong background in Linux administration, automation, and AWS cloud services. The successful candidate will work during night shift hours (11 PM - 8 AM EST) to support critical systems and infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage and maintain Linux environments, including RHEL 6/7/8/9, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu, and CentOS .
  • Work extensively with AWS services , particularly EC2, AMI, EBS, S3, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, and IAM .
  • Utilize Ansible or Ansible Automation Platform (AAP) to write and manage complex playbooks for automation.
  • Develop and maintain scripting solutions using Bash, Python, Terraform, and YAML to automate system tasks.
  • Administer and manage RedHat Satellite , overseeing master satellite server and capsule server infrastructure for a fleet of approximately 35 ships.
  • Support and troubleshoot file transfer protocols such as SFTP, FTP, FTPS, SCP, CIFS, SMB, and NFS .
  • Work with virtualization technologies like VMware and VMware Cloud (VMC) .
  • Configure and maintain web technologies, including HTTPD, Tomcat, and NGINX .
  • Utilize Git, GitLab, or GitHub for version control and code management.
  • Document processes and manage incidents using ServiceNow, Jira, and Confluence .
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide 24/7 system support as required.


Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in Linux administration with strong troubleshooting skills.
  • Expertise in automation tools , particularly Ansible Tower/AAP .
  • Hands-on experience with AWS cloud services .
  • Strong scripting skills in Bash, Python, Terraform, and YAML .
  • Experience managing RedHat Satellite infrastructure .
  • Understanding of file transfer protocols and security best practices.
  • Experience working with virtualization and containerization technologies .
  • Strong documentation and communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative in solving complex issues.


Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Docker and containerization technologies .
  • Familiarity with Morpheus Hybrid Cloud .
  • Knowledge of Tanium Endpoint Management .
  • Exposure to database technologies such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MySQL .


This is an excellent opportunity for a skilled Linux Administrator to work with cutting-edge technology in a dynamic environment. If you have a passion for automation, cloud infrastructure, and Linux systems, we encourage you to apply!

title: Account Executive
description:
Our Client:

Our client is one of the fastest growing AI startups, revolutionising the SME market with AI-powered Sales Development Representatives (SDRs). Their mission is to liberate SMEs and their team from the grind, unlocking time and energy for what truly matters. Their AI-powered humanoids excel in lead qualification, scheduling calls, and closing e-commerce sales, enhancing the sales efficiency of SMEs.


  • Role Overview: They‚Äôre looking for a highly motivated B2B SaaS Sales Executive to target SMEs needing sales development support. You'll be instrumental in understanding client needs, demonstrating our AI SDR capabilities, and closing sales efficiently. This role is ideal for a self-managing, growth-oriented individual with a proven track record in self-learning and enhancing sales skills.


Key Responsibilities.

  • Engage SMEs through consultative sales, identifying needs and pitching AI SDR solutions.
  • Manage the entire sales cycle, from lead generation to closure, ensuring maximum efficiency.
  • Continuously self-learn and adapt to enhance sales techniques and knowledge.
  • Top-performing salesperson in the team, leveraging outstanding closing skills.


Requirements:

  • Proven B2B SaaS sales experience, specifically with SMEs.
  • Self-managing with a strong growth mindset.
  • History of self-learning through books, courses, and other resources to refine sales skills.
  • Renowned as a top closer in previous sales teams.
  • Skilled in digital communication and sales platforms, especially video calls.


What They Offer:

  • A pivotal role in a fast-growing AI startup with a unique product offering.
  • Competitive compensation, including sales-driven incentives.
  • A chance to grow to lead a sales team in a high-growth market.
  • A collaborative, innovative, and supportive work culture.
  • Opportunities for professional growth in the emerging field of AI solutions.

title: Supply Chain Planning Manager
description:
HCLTech is a global technology company, home to 227,000+ people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering and cloud, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending September 2022 totaled $12.1 billion.

To learn how we can supercharge progress for you, visit


As a Product planner, Demand & Supply Planning Program Manager , you will be responsible for the data center equipment supply planning for sustaining and new products, interpretation of the data center demand signal and translating it to a supply & inventory plan for equipment and drive optimal planning decisions. You will work closely with Data Center Supply Planning, Purchasing, Engineering, Fulfillment, Commodity Management, and Contract Manufacturing teams to develop and oversee the execution of an accurate supply and inventory plan through the product life cycle.


You will apply your knowledge of supply chain principles and your problem solving prowess to key planning processes. You will establish and drive metrics, drive process and system improvements to accomplish efficiency and scalability goals and influence our rapidly growing data center infrastructure supply chain.


Responsibilities:

Manage material demand & supply, including inventory, to meet existing and new product demand requirements to meet business objectives, coordinating with Demand Planning on changes to demand which impacts delivery of key components as demand needs fluctuate

Proactive communication of sustaining and new product material plans and status to internal customers.

Identify and quickly solve supply chain gaps and inefficiencies. Clearly document process solutions and requirements. Define and manage clear business metrics and goals to manage supply chain performance

Leverage Market intelligence and Statistical inputs towards driving continued, sustained improvements of inventory models and supply chain buffers.

Develop short and long term supply models to minimize total costs and inventories while maintaining service levels, develop and justify inventory buffer strategies that optimize cost and flexibility.


Minimum Qualifications (MQs)

  • BA/BS degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering or equivalent practical experience in relevant industry
  • Project Management experience with the ability to communicate/collaborate cross-functionally with technical/non-technical groups spanning all organizational levels
  • Experience using Material Requirements Planning Tools
  • Spreadsheet/database capabilities, able to create models and maneuver within them to manage supply chain processes


Preferred Qualifications (PQs)

  • MS/MBA degree in Business Process Management, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management or related planning disciplines.
  • Expertise in Analytics / SQL / BigQuery
  • A Supply Chain Certification
  • Knowledge of financial and cost accounting practices
  • Deep knowledge of S&OP processes as well as experience in development and implementation of planning systems and processes
  • Understanding and experience in using Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems and tools
  • Experience in planning materials for new product launches and transitions

title: PPC Manager (Remote)
description:
PPC Manager (Remote)Who we are:

Pareto Legal is a group of hardcore problem-solving, status-quo breaking, out-of-the-box thinking, genius digital bad-asses breaking out the creative solutions with a vengeance and the passion of a thousand suns.


More specifically, we are a digital marketing agency with a special focus on high-end digital advertising for law firms, and we are the BEST at what we do! We‚Äôre headquartered in Philadelphia, PA with team members across the United States, Mexico, Argentina and Colombia.¬†


We have a small yet growing team that is committed to working hard to make sure our clients are successful. We‚Äôre looking for other highly motivated and driven people who want to grow personally, professionally and financially - all while making a positive impact for our clients. Is that you?


Check out our website: legal.paretoppc.com


Who we‚Äôre looking for:

We are looking for an exceptional PPC manager to turn our clients‚Äô digital advertising campaigns into case-generating machines!


In this remote role, you will be critical in the support, growth and enhancement of client relationships and drive growth. In this remote role, you'll support client marketing portfolios, monitor account performance, and partner with clients and internal teams to optimize strategies. You will report to our VP, Client Strategy.


Core Responsibilities:

  • Work with our VP of Client Strategy to develop PPC & LSA strategy for our law firm clients. This entails planning and managing campaign performance, account setup, strategy development, management, budget allocation, optimization and audits across major PPC engines, including Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Microsoft Ads & Google Local Services Ads.
  • Optimize campaigns to meet client objectives, such as daily management of campaign budgets, bid management, negative keywords, website and category exclusions, ad creative, and landing page revisions
  • Develop tests and experiments to drive increasingly better results
  • Manage all client recurring client tasks and ad hoc requests using project management software (ClickUp)
  • Identify new growth opportunities for your respective clients (and recommend and implement the ideas that have the highest probability of success)
  • Deliver monthly reporting findings, insights and recommendations/next steps to our Client Success Manager (CSM) to present to the client
  • Demonstrate resourcefulness and the initiative to lead advanced projects
  • Forecast, plan, and work towards achieving account growth objectives
  • Proactively keep abreast of industry trends and share knowledge with team
  • Support sales efforts for all new prospective clients by assisting with PPC account assessments


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

You‚Äôll be graded on these lead and lag key performance indicators (in no particular order):


Lead KPIs:

  • NPS: assesses client satisfaction with our team and quality of service

Lag KPIs:

  • Client ROI / results: gauges how well the campaigns or services managed by the PPC manager are performing in terms of delivering results (e.g. leads, cases, etc.)
  • Client retention rate (churn rate): measures the percentage of clients retained over a specific period of time


The ideal candidate:

  • Communication Skills: You are a clear and engaging communicator, both in writing and verbally. You excel at building rapport and trust, enabling quick buy-in from clients and colleagues. As a vital link between clients and our internal experts, you ensure everyone feels seen and heard.
  • Marketing Strategy: With strong marketing experience, you understand various channels and actively learn about clients‚Äô businesses and goals. You guide clients in implementing strategies that drive revenue and profits, making impactful recommendations for website changes or new marketing materials. We need you to be a proactive strategist, not just a box checker.
  • Analytical Skills: You thrive on data and enjoy analyzing numbers to inform strategic decisions. You know how to gather data, extract meaningful insights, and translate those insights into actionable recommendations that benefit our clients.
  • Problem Solving: We seek individuals who take initiative and ‚Äúfigure it out‚Äù rather than relying on others. While we support you when needed, you are expected to bring solutions and overcome challenges independently.


Right fit personality profile:

You are an equal parts confident and charismatic communicator + a skilled and pragmatic catalyzer whose focus on achievement and success can help those around you accomplish goals. Motivated by outcomes and results, you speak directly, make decisions quickly, and you like to take charge in every situation and explore worthwhile, effective solutions. Your determination and belief in your abilities make you a strong leader.


Important personality traits:¬†

  • Empathetic : Understand clients‚Äô needs to build strong relationships.
  • Adaptable : Flexible in adjusting strategies based on client needs.
  • Organized : Efficiently manage multiple clients and projects.
  • Positive : Maintain enthusiasm in challenging situations.
  • Collaborative : Work effectively with internal teams for cohesive campaigns.
  • Resilient : The ability to remain composed under pressure and stay focused on client goals.

What energizes you:

  • Getting results
  • Positive client feedback
  • Ambitious goals
  • Challenges
  • Professional growth
  • Helping your clients and your team succeed!


Make sure you‚Äôre comfortable with:

  • Remote working. This is a remote (work from home) position.
  • All job offers start with a 90-day trial to make sure that we‚Äôre the right fit for each other.
  • Traveling at least once per year for our company all-hands meeting.
  • Weekly feedback and coaching from your manager.
  • A fast-paced ever-changing work environment.


Our values:

We Care: we care for our employees, our clients and most importantly, ourselves.


We Get Results: we focus on effort over results for the short-term and results over effort for the long term.


We Take Ownership: we own everything to the extreme - the good, the bad and the ugly - from start to finish.


We Communicate : we recognize that clear, proactive communication prevents misunderstandings, keeps key information top of mind, and makes sure everyone is on the same page.


We Learn: we encourage learning through immediate action and recognize that ‚Äútolerated failure‚Äù imprints learning better than comfortable success.


Qualifications

  • Four year bachelor's degree in marketing, business, communications, or a related field
  • 5+ years of digital advertising and PPC experience in an agency setting
  • 3+ years of experience working with law firm PPC accounts, specifically law firms in the personal injury, criminal defense and family law (divorce, custody, etc.) is required
  • Knowledge of the following digital marketing channels and tactics is a plus: SEO, email, social media marketing and CRO
  • Proven record of success meeting and exceeding revenue and retention targets
  • Proficient with G Suite and Microsoft Office platforms
  • Experience with ClickUp, Salesforce, and/or Hubspot is a plus.

title: Artificial Intelligence Specialist
description:
Job Title: AI Specialist - YouTube Content Automation

Location: (Global - time zone overlap with CST preferred)

Salary Range: up to 2750 USD


Work Schedule: Flexible hours with some overlap with Central Time (CST) preferred


NOTE: INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR POSITION


Company Overview:


Sagan is an exclusive membership community for top executives, founders, and CEOs seeking to hire and maximize the impact of international talent. We bridge the gap between global talent and US-based businesses, connecting candidates from vibrant regions like Latin America, the Philippines, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Africa with leading American companies. Discover a world of career possibilities with Sagan.


About the Company:


Sagan represents a fast-paced creative team at the intersection of AI and content production. The team is focused on leveraging emerging technology to streamline and enhance video workflows, particularly in the YouTube ecosystem.


Position Overview:


Were looking for a technically curious and creatively minded AI Specialist to help supercharge our YouTube content production. You won't be making the videos -- but you'll be the key enabler, integrating AI tools to improve how scripts are written, visuals are created, and animations come to life. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on experimentation and wants to bring cutting-edge AI into practical, everyday use for a high-performing creative team.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Research and evaluate new AI tools relevant to video production (e.g., ChatGPT, Runway ML, Midjourney, ElevenLabs, Pika Labs).
  • Build tailored prompts and lightweight automations to assist scriptwriters, editors, and designers.
  • Support the animation team by identifying AI tools that aid 3D model generation or pipeline acceleration.
  • Develop or help coordinate small-scale internal tool integrations (e.g., APIs, internal dashboards).
  • Partner with creative team members to identify workflow pain points and recommend AI-powered solutions.
  • Create simple training materials or documentation to help teammates adopt new tools.


Qualifications:

  • Experience using AI tools in a content creation context (especially YouTube, TikTok, or short-form video).
  • Strong prompting skills with tools like ChatGPT, Midjourney, Runway ML.
  • Technically intuitive and quick to test and evaluate new tools.
  • High curiosity and creativity in solving workflow challenges.
  • Strong English communication skills.
  • Comfortable working independently and asynchronously.


Nice-to-Haves:

  • Experience with APIs or no-code tools (Python, Make/Zapier, OpenAI API).
  • Basic understanding of 3D modeling workflows.
  • Background in YouTube or video production environments.
  • Familiarity with editing tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, or Blender.
  • Ability to document and train others on tool usage.

Sagan is an exclusive membership community for top executives, founders, and CEOs seeking to hire and maximize the impact of international talent. We bridge the gap between global talent and US-based businesses, connecting candidates from vibrant regions like Latin America, the Philippines, India, Pakistan, Bangladesh, and Africa with leading American companies. Discover a world of career possibilities with Sagan.


About the Company:


Sagan represents a fast-paced creative team at the intersection of AI and content production. The team is focused on leveraging emerging technology to streamline and enhance video workflows, particularly in the YouTube ecosystem.


Position Overview:


Were looking for a technically curious and creatively minded AI Specialist to help supercharge our YouTube content production. You won't be making the videos -- but you'll be the key enabler, integrating AI tools to improve how scripts are written, visuals are created, and animations come to life. This role is ideal for someone who thrives on experimentation and wants to bring cutting-edge AI into practical, everyday use for a high-performing creative team.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Research and evaluate new AI tools relevant to video production (e.g., ChatGPT, Runway ML, Midjourney, ElevenLabs, Pika Labs).
  • Build tailored prompts and lightweight automations to assist scriptwriters, editors, and designers.
  • Support the animation team by identifying AI tools that aid 3D model generation or pipeline acceleration.
  • Develop or help coordinate small-scale internal tool integrations (e.g., APIs, internal dashboards).
  • Partner with creative team members to identify workflow pain points and recommend AI-powered solutions.
  • Create simple training materials or documentation to help teammates adopt new tools.


Qualifications:

  • Experience using AI tools in a content creation context (especially YouTube, TikTok, or short-form video).
  • Strong prompting skills with tools like ChatGPT, Midjourney, Runway ML.
  • Technically intuitive and quick to test and evaluate new tools.
  • High curiosity and creativity in solving workflow challenges.
  • Strong English communication skills.
  • Comfortable working independently and asynchronously.


Nice-to-Haves:

  • Experience with APIs or no-code tools (Python, Make/Zapier, OpenAI API).
  • Basic understanding of 3D modeling workflows.
  • Background in YouTube or video production environments.
  • Familiarity with editing tools like CapCut, Premiere Pro, or Blender.
  • Ability to document and train others on tool usage.

title: Salesforce Delivery Management
description:
HCLTech is a global technology company, home to 227,000+ people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering and cloud, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending September 2022 totaled $12.1 billion.

To learn how we can supercharge progress for you, visit


Job Description:

  • IT experience
  • Must have experience in handling large Salesforce project as Delivery manager / Program manager / Delivery leadership / Governance
  • Should have strong implementation experience of the Salesforce CRM platform
  • Should have strong experience in managing multiple Salesforce projects simultaneously, using project management methodologies (e.g., Agile).
  • Should be capable of managing big team with prime responsibility as Delivery and operations for multiple track
  • Should have excellent communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills to effectively manage teams and stakeholders.
  • Responsible for Epic and feature releases to client as per quarter plan.
  • Conducting Monthly Governance and weekly status update with business & IT stakeholders
  • Closely engaged with Salesforce to build an umbrella solution for Senior executive reporting


Why choose us?

We are one of the fastest growing technology companies in the world, with more than 60 offices around the world and a global team of 227,000 employees.

Our company is extremely diverse, with 165 nationalities represented.

We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues around the world.

We offer a flexible and remote work environment, prioritizing the integration between work and personal life.

We are committed to your growth, offering learning and career development opportunities at all levels.

We offer comprehensive benefits for all employees.

Certified as "Great Place to Work" and "Top Employer" in 25 countries, recognized as "Top Employer" in Brazil, providing a positive work environment that values employee recognition and respect.


Equality & Opportunity for All

Representing 165 nationalities across the globe, we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.

title: Application Security Engineer III
description:
Overview

When you think of InComm Payments, think of Innovative Payments Technology. We were founded over 30 years ago and continue to be a pioneer in the payment (FinTech) industry. Since our inception, we have grown to be a team of over 3,000 employees in 35 countries around the world. We own over 400 global technical patents and a network that includes over 525,000 points of retail distribution that points to our industry expertise.


We are creating nearly 200 Fully Remote jobs in Brazil for various financial technology (Fintech) engineering, database, development, and testing teams.


InComm Payments is highly focused on our people and their growth, and we work hard to make a career at InComm Payments meaningful and rewarding. We value innovation, quality, passion, integrity and responsibility in all that we do, and we are looking for great people to join our team as we move forward towards a very bright future. We anticipate developing future leaders for our teams in Brazil!


Benefits include health and dental insurance, meal and restaurant vouchers, fixed monthly stipend for internet and mobile expenses, InComm hardware/software, and annual bonuses! All positions are CLT.


You can learn more about InComm Payments by visiting our Website or connecting with us on LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.


About This Opportunity

Our Global Enterprise Security Team is growing in Brazil and we are seeking a dedicated and experienced Senior Application Security Engineer to join our growing team! You will work with a dynamic group of professionals dispersed across North and South America supporting our global business that spans 5 continents. You will play a crucial part in safeguarding our applications from potential threats and vulnerabilities. With a few years of hands-on experience, you will conduct thorough security assessments, implement robust security measures, and ensure compliance with industry standards. Your strong analytical skills and deep understanding of modern security protocols and tools will be essential in identifying and mitigating risks early in the development lifecycle. You will report to the Enterprise Application Security group which works closely with software development and application ownership teams across various business units to help develop more secure applications and products. Join us as we secure applications and products across the entire InComm Payments enterprise!


CLT and fully remote position. Must reside in Brazil. Benefits include:

  • Health and dental insurance
  • Meal and restaurant vouchers
  • Fixed monthly stipend for internet and mobile expenses
  • Company-issued device


Responsibilities

  • Integrate SAST tooling into CI/CD pipelines, ensuring compatibility and efficient scanning within development workflows.
  • Provide tailored SAST integration support for development teams at varying maturity levels with diverse toolsets and security requirements.
  • Analyze application logs for anomalous patterns, communicate findings to leadership, and persuade them to take appropriate action.
  • Participate in on-call rotation in support of WAF incidents.
  • Validate security vulnerabilities identified by automated tools and fine-tune configurations to minimize false positives and reduce noise.
  • Develop threat models with development teams to help expose risks in their deliverables.
  • Participate in application design and architectural reviews.
  • Facilitate activities such as blue/red team events and bug bounty programs.
  • Lead prioritization discussions to gain traction on important security issues
  • Act as a liaison with 3rd parties performing vulnerability scans and penetration testing to validate findings and inform priorities and strategies for remediation.
  • Draft, evaluate, and monitor compliance with application and development security standards.
  • Ensure development teams are validating for OWASP Top 10 and performing industry leading application security practices.


Qualifications

  • 5+ years of application security experience.
  • Strong background with CI/CD processes and associated tooling, such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure Pipelines, or similar.
  • Strong scripting experience - PowerShell, Python, etc.
  • Extensive experience with SAST & DAST application scanning tools and knowledge of OWASP methodologies
  • Application security experience with high level programming languages (e.g., Java, C, C++, C#, VB, .NET, ASP.NET, ASP, PHP, J2EE, JSP)
  • Experience with Container technologies - Docker, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes
  • Experience with Cloud Service Providers (Azure and/or AWS)
  • Knowledge of Web Application Firewalls (WAF)
  • Experience with performing web, API, and mobile manual penetration testing; preparing reports to document findings; and presenting the report to development teams.
  • Familiarity with regulatory controls and industry best practices such as HIPAA, PCI, HiTrust, NIST etc.
  • Communication skills to create documentation, videos and conduct training classes
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet established deadlines.
  • Ability to collaborate with IT teams on security-related tasks and projects.
  • Ability to work productively while remote and communicate effectively in a virtual team environment.
  • Ability to stay current with new technology.


Education & Certifications

  • Education: Associate Degree, or, Technologo (Technologist) Degree, or higher is required.
  • A CISSP certification is preferred, but not required. Career development plan to include certifications upon hire.


InComm Payments provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, citizenship, veteran‚Äôs status, age, disability status, genetics or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.


This position is eligible for the Employee Referral Bonus Program - Tier 4

title: Senior ServiceNow ITOM Developer
description:
We are looking for an experienced ServiceNow ITOM Senior Developer with a strong background in ITSM and infrastructure to architect, develop, and optimize ITOM capabilities within the ServiceNow platform . The ideal candidate will have in-depth technical expertise across infrastructure domains‚Äîincluding servers, networks, and applications‚Äîand a strong ability to troubleshoot and deliver scalable IT operations solutions aligned with enterprise needs.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and implement ITOM solutions using ServiceNow, in line with enterprise architecture and operational strategies.
  • Configure and maintain core ServiceNow ITOM modules , including Discovery, CMDB , and Event Management .
  • Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to align IT operations capabilities with organizational objectives.
  • Continuously enhance the ServiceNow platform to ensure performance, scalability, and reliability.
  • Diagnose and resolve issues across ITOM functionalities and ensure optimal platform performance and integration efficiency.

Required Skills & Experience:

  • Minimum 6 years of hands-on experience implementing and supporting ServiceNow ITOM modules ‚Äîespecially Discovery, CMDB , and Event Management .
  • Strong understanding of ServiceNow CMDB structure and Event Correlation Rules .
  • Solid grasp of server, network, and application architecture , with troubleshooting abilities across infrastructure layers.
  • Experience with the ServiceNow database schema , tables, and data modeling.
  • Proficient in Performance Analytics , email notification design, and managing complex data workflows .
  • Expertise in using transform maps, data sources, and scripts for effective data import and integration.
  • Skilled in developing and managing scheduled jobs, events , and automated triggers within ServiceNow.
  • Experience with REST/SOAP API integrations , import sets, and custom integrations using scripted approaches .

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
About Eightpoint


Eightpoint is an internet technology company specializing in the agile development of products and content that address real-world interests, captivating users and driving significant growth for partners. With offices in the United States and Cayman Islands, Eightpoint collaborates with partners globally on the next generation of user-centric offerings. Our growing ecosystem includes innovative products like Weather Now, a sleek app that delivers real-time forecasts with clarity and ranks among the top three most-used weather apps in the U.S.; Check Heart Rate Now, a quick and easy wellness monitor; and Wave Browser, a powerful and secure way to search the web. Every product we launch is designed to engage users, enhance daily life, and deliver real-world value. Backed by data and driven by a relentless commitment to quality, Eightpoint moves fast, thinks big, and builds digital experiences that people love.


About the Role


We are looking for a highly skilled and proactive Full Stack Engineer to join our team and take ownership of critical infrastructure spanning SDK development, payments integration, and backend services. You will play a key role in building white-labeled payment solutions, integrating third-party monetization platforms, and developing internal tools to streamline our developer experience.


Where You'll Make an Impact


  • Integrate RevenueCat or Qonversion with custom wrappers

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Company Description

Predict.law allows personal injury attorneys and their firms to predict case outcomes with AI, simulate changes to cases, and share professional case reports with colleagues and clients.


Role Description

This is a full-time remote role for a Senior Data Scientist at Predict.law. The Senior Data Scientist will be responsible for predictive modeling, recommendation modeling, feature generation, hyper parameter tuning, exploratory data analysis, model versioning, optimizing for performance, and explaining data findings on a day-to-day basis.

  • Statistics skills
  • Data Analytics skills
  • Data Analysis skills
  • Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities
  • Experience with machine learning and AI technologies
  • Advanced degree in a related field such as Data Science, Statistics, or Mathematics

title: Sales Manager Brazil
description:
Sales Manager - Solar PV Industry (Brazil)

Location: S√£o Paulo or Remote (Brazil)
Contract Type: Full-time

About the Role:

We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Sales Manager to lead commercial activities in Brazil within the fast-evolving solar photovoltaic (PV) industry. This is a unique opportunity to join one of the world's top-ranked solar manufacturers, recognized globally for its rapid growth, technological leadership, and vertically integrated production capacity. The company is a global benchmark in the solar supply chain and is actively expanding its presence in the Latin American market, offering an exceptional platform for ambitious professionals looking to make a difference.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive sales strategy to increase market share and achieve revenue targets in Brazil.

  • Identify and cultivate strong relationships with EPCs, distributors, developers, and other key market stakeholders.

  • Drive commercial negotiations, contract closing, and post-sales follow-up, ensuring an outstanding customer experience.

  • Analyze market trends and competitor activity to refine sales approaches and capitalize on emerging opportunities.

  • Represent the company at local and international trade shows, conferences, and client meetings.

  • Collaborate with global and regional teams, including logistics, finance, technical support, and marketing, to ensure seamless project execution.

  • Provide regular reporting on sales performance, pipeline development, and customer feedback to regional leadership.

  • Maintain a deep understanding of regulatory, policy, and incentive frameworks affecting the Brazilian solar market.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Business Administration, International Trade, or related field.

  • Minimum of 5 years of proven experience in sales or business development within the solar PV or renewable energy industry in Brazil.

  • Demonstrated success managing commercial cycles with developers, EPCs, and utility-scale clients.

  • Strong understanding of PV module technologies and supply chain logistics.

  • Ability to work independently and navigate complex, matrixed organizations.

  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills.

  • Fluent in Portuguese and English ; Spanish is a plus.

  • Availability to travel regularly within Brazil and occasionally internationally.

What's Offered:

  • Join a top-tier global solar technology leader with one of the largest market shares worldwide .

  • Access to cutting-edge PV products and a robust supply chain.

  • Competitive compensation package with performance-based incentives.

  • A high-growth environment with room for career advancement in a booming regional market.

  • Be part of a mission-driven organization accelerating the global energy transition.

title: Junior Legal Counsel - iGaming/Live Casino - Remote Brazil
description:
We are looking for a junior-level legal professional to contribute to the dynamic and fast-evolving iGaming sector across Latin America. The Junior Legal Counsel will play a key supporting role within the regional legal team, providing essential legal services that ensure compliance, mitigate risk, and support commercial and operational initiatives. The position is ideal for a recently licensed lawyer with a strong interest in technology, digital entertainment, and international business.


Reporting directly to the Latam Legal Manager, the Junior Legal Counsel will be involved in a broad range of legal matters including contract negotiation, regulatory research, internal policy development, and support for strategic projects‚Äîsuch as the launch of a live casino studio in Brazil. This role offers a unique opportunity to grow within a global, multicultural environment while gaining hands-on experience in cross-border legal operations and innovation-driven industries.


What You Will Be Doing:

  • Drafting all types of tech-based agreements and legal documents (License of IP, SaaS, software provision, NDA‚Äôs etc.)
  • Following up on multi-national regulation and staying abreast with upcoming norms in Latam.
  • Aiding with local regulatory authorities for the development of a live casino studio
  • Assisting in building a scalable foundation for Brazil‚Äôs live casino studio including developing templates, processes, dealing with custom agencies, employees, etc.
  • Maintaining record of local and global policies and procedures and uphold them internally.

What We Need From You:

  • Licensed lawyer in Brazil with issued professional card to exercise law,
  • Goal-oriented and driven for excellence,
  • English and Portuguese proficiency, writing and reading.
  • Enjoy working in fast-paced and tech-based environments,
  • Capacity to adapt to multi-national and multi-cultural legal work.

title: Ecommerce Growth Marketing Paid Media Specialist
description:
We are a DTC Ecommerce Growth Consulting & Marketing Company focused on helping service businesses attract, engage, and convert their ideal audience.

Our Mission: to help DTC ecommerce companies grow holistically

Our Vision: We imagine a world where service businesses never have to worry about meeting revenue goals, attracting consistent quality customers, retaining customers, or maintaining and growing their overall online presence.


Our Values:

- Treat others the way we want to be treated

- Pay close attention to detail¬†

- Don't neglect the small things, they matter

- Think critically and be a problem solver, not a problem creator

- Confidence and determination to achieve our vision.


Who We Are Looking For:


We are looking for an ecommerce Paid Media Specialist who has experience managing large ad budgets across Meta and Google primarily. (Ideally over 1 million dollars USD per month).


The candidate selected for this role would come in and manage the Meta, Google, and/or TikTok ad accounts for US based ecommerce brands. We have a lot of high-profile ecommerce clients that we work with and we are looking for a seasoned Paid Media Specialist who can produce high quality results for our clients.


The right candidate will be task-oriented, analytical, and willing to keep the team and ad accounts on pace to make sure we are meeting or exceeding client expectations. A self-starter who can see problems and go to work fixing them and not be just an order taker. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in managing Facebook Ads and Google Ads for US based ecommerce brands.


Must have a portfolio of work that demonstrates the results that you have been able to provide and the KPIs you have hit. Must also demonstrate your skills with creative testing through media buying on Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok ads.


Responsibilities

  • Manage the Meta, Google, and/or TikTok ad accounts of US based ecommerce brands
  • Run ad campaigns across Meta, Google, and TikTok
  • Monitor ROAS, ad budgets, revenue, and core KPIs to optimize campaigns and achieve the desired results for our clients
  • Run profitable creative testing campaigns and identify trends to be able to communicate with the client what is working and what we should be creating more of
  • Create performance marketing reports for the accounts that you are managing to accurately display the analytics, results, and next steps
  • Strategize on ways to improve the overall marketing strategy for our brands to increase effectiveness
  • Maintain awareness of current industry and technology standards, social media, competitive landscape, and market trends


Qualifications & Experience

  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing or related field OR 3-4 years of experience OR alternative education experience (mentors or courses)
  • Prior experience working for an ecommerce brand or advertising agency is preferred
  • Must be proficient in Facebook & Google Ads management for ecommerce brands
  • Must be proficient in scaling ad budgets
  • Strong communication, conceptual thinking, and a hunger to always provide great results for our clients
  • Autonomous worker with an analytical mind
  • Portfolio of work, results, or case studies
  • You should be comfortable using some internal communication tools such as Monday.com, Google Drive, Zoom, and Slack for team meetings and to support other team members with any technical request. Experience with Monday.com or Asana is not required but please let us know if you have used it before or not.
  • You should also be confident enough to push back on the leadership team and express your opinion if you think the ship is heading off course. We encourage that.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
About Ascendion

Ascendion is a full-service digital engineering solutions company. We make and manage software platforms and products that power growth and deliver captivating experiences to consumers and employees. Our engineering, cloud, data, experience design, and talent solution capabilities accelerate transformation and impact for enterprise clients. Headquartered in New Jersey, our workforce of 6,000+ Ascenders delivers solutions from around the globe. Ascendion is built differently to engineer the next.

Ascendion | Engineering to elevate life

We have a culture built on opportunity, inclusion, and a spirit of partnership. Come, change the world with us:

  • Build the coolest tech for world‚Äôs leading brands
  • Solve complex problems ‚Äì and learn new skills
  • Experience the power of transforming digital engineering for Fortune 500 clients
  • Master your craft with leading training programs and hands-on experience

Experience a community of change makers!

Join a culture of high-performing innovators with endless ideas and a passion for tech. Our culture is the fabric of our company, and it is what makes us unique and diverse. The way we share ideas, learning, experiences, successes, and joy allows everyone to be their best at Ascendion.

About the Role:


  • Role: UX Designer Location: LATAM
  • Employment Type: Full time


Job Summary:

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and maintain automated test scripts using tools such as Selenium, Cucumber, TestNG, JUnit, and SpecFlow
  • Conduct API testing for RESTful services using Postman, RestAssured, and ReadyAPI.
  • Write clean, efficient code for automation scripts in Java, C#, Python, and JavaScript.
  • Integrate automated tests within CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins and Azure DevOps.
  • Employ test and bug management tools like Jira, qTest, and Squash TM to track defects and ensure quality.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define testing strategies and drive quality throughout the software development lifecycle.
  • Analyze test results and provide detailed reports to stakeholders.


Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in developing automated test frameworks and writing test scripts with Selenium, Cucumber, TestNG, JUnit, and SpecFlow
  • Hands-on experience with API testing tools such as Postman, RestAssured, and ReadyAPI
  • Proficient in programming/scripting languages: Java, C#, Python, or JavaScript.
  • Familiarity with CI/CD tools including Jenkins and Azure DevOps
  • Experience using test and bug management tools: Jira, qTest, and Squash TM.
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Tell us about your experiences, education, and ambitions. Bring your knowledge, unique viewpoint, and creativity to the table. Let‚Äôs talk!

title: Supply Chain Planning Manager
description:
HCLTech is a global technology company, home to 227,000+ people across 60 countries, delivering industry-leading capabilities centered around digital, engineering and cloud, powered by a broad portfolio of technology services and products. We work with clients across all major verticals, providing industry solutions for Financial Services, Manufacturing, Life Sciences and Healthcare, Technology and Services, Telecom and Media, Retail and CPG, and Public Services. Consolidated revenues as of 12 months ending September 2022 totaled $12.1 billion.

To learn how we can supercharge progress for you, visit


As a Product planner, Demand & Supply Planning Program Manager , you will be responsible for the data center equipment supply planning for sustaining and new products, interpretation of the data center demand signal and translating it to a supply & inventory plan for equipment and drive optimal planning decisions. You will work closely with Data Center Supply Planning, Purchasing, Engineering, Fulfillment, Commodity Management, and Contract Manufacturing teams to develop and oversee the execution of an accurate supply and inventory plan through the product life cycle.


You will apply your knowledge of supply chain principles and your problem solving prowess to key planning processes. You will establish and drive metrics, drive process and system improvements to accomplish efficiency and scalability goals and influence our rapidly growing data center infrastructure supply chain.


Responsibilities:

Manage material demand & supply, including inventory, to meet existing and new product demand requirements to meet business objectives, coordinating with Demand Planning on changes to demand which impacts delivery of key components as demand needs fluctuate

Proactive communication of sustaining and new product material plans and status to internal customers.

Identify and quickly solve supply chain gaps and inefficiencies. Clearly document process solutions and requirements. Define and manage clear business metrics and goals to manage supply chain performance

Leverage Market intelligence and Statistical inputs towards driving continued, sustained improvements of inventory models and supply chain buffers.

Develop short and long term supply models to minimize total costs and inventories while maintaining service levels, develop and justify inventory buffer strategies that optimize cost and flexibility.


Minimum Qualifications (MQs)

  • BA/BS degree in Supply Chain, Industrial Engineering or equivalent practical experience in relevant industry
  • Project Management experience with the ability to communicate/collaborate cross-functionally with technical/non-technical groups spanning all organizational levels
  • Experience using Material Requirements Planning Tools
  • Spreadsheet/database capabilities, able to create models and maneuver within them to manage supply chain processes


Preferred Qualifications (PQs)

  • MS/MBA degree in Business Process Management, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain Management or related planning disciplines.
  • Expertise in Analytics / SQL / BigQuery
  • A Supply Chain Certification
  • Knowledge of financial and cost accounting practices
  • Deep knowledge of S&OP processes as well as experience in development and implementation of planning systems and processes
  • Understanding and experience in using Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) systems and tools
  • Experience in planning materials for new product launches and transitions

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
At Fidelis Security , we empower organizations to detect, respond, and recover from advanced cyber threats faster and smarter. We're growing fast and looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help expand and evolve our server-side architecture and microservices ecosystem.


Responsibilities:

  • Build and enhance APIs, data pipelines, and storage solutions that scale.
  • Extend our microservice architecture with new features and capabilities.
  • Refactor and modernize our tech stack to ensure high performance and resilience.
  • Collaborate in a distributed team environment that values autonomy and impact.
  • Optimize system performance, maintainability, and deployment workflows.
  • Work hands-on with infrastructure as code and continuous delivery practices.
  • Monitor production systems and iterate based on real-world data.


Requirements:

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience.
  • Go (required), experience with Ruby, Java, Python, or Bash is a plus
  • Experience with Git, code reviews, pull requests, CI/CD pipelines, IaC tools.
  • Experience with either AWS, GCP, or Azure is required.
  • Familiar with both relational (PostgreSQL) and NoSQL (Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Memcached).

title: Sourcer Analyst ‚Äì VAGA AFIRMATIVA PCD
description:
Job Title: Sourcer Analyst ‚Äì Exclusive PWD

This is an affirmative position exclusive to persons PCD in Brazil.

Location: Remote (Brazil)

Employment Type: Contract


About the Role

We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented Sourcing Analyst to join our recruitment team in the HR and talent acquisition sector. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, attracting, and engaging potential candidates through various sourcing strategies. You will also support internal recruitment operations by assisting with sourcing, CV formatting, interview scheduling, and documentation.


Responsibilities

‚Ä¢ Use proactive sourcing strategies to identify active and passive candidates

‚Ä¢ Generate interest in open roles and build a strong talent pipeline

‚Ä¢ Conduct initial candidate screenings and collaborate with recruiters

‚Ä¢ Focus on hard-to-fill and technical roles

‚Ä¢ Perform market analysis and salary benchmarking

‚Ä¢ Maintain and update internal recruitment documentation

‚Ä¢ Assist with CV formatting and interview scheduling


Requirements

‚Ä¢ Skilled in Boolean search techniques

‚Ä¢ Experience with candidate relationship management (CRM) systems

‚Ä¢ Strong communication and research abilities

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience in sourcing or recruitment

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree in Psychology, Administration, Human Resources, or related fields


Preferred Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Experience sourcing for technical or niche roles

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS)

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently in a fast-paced, remote environment

English Intermediate


Who We Are

Talent where you need it, when you need it!

SGF Global is a leading specialized talent solutions provider dedicated to connecting highly qualified professionals with opportunities across multiple sectors. We offer contract, temporary, and permanent hiring solutions for roles in technology, finance and accounting, engineering, marketing and creative, legal services, administrative and customer support, energy, oil and gas, telecommunications, manufacturing, aerospace, life sciences, mining, and utilities.

title: Back End Developer
description:
IMPORTANT: MUST HAVE PROFESSIONAL BACK-END EXPERIENCE. IF YOU DON'T HAVE THIS PLEASE DO NOT BOTHER APPLYING AS WE WILL SEND AN AUTOMATIC REJECTION


Back-End Software Developer


Job Description

Want to use your passion & expertise to develop cutting edge AI software? This is your chance to apply your coding skills and help deliver transformative technology to leading brands, retailers and marketplaces in eCommerce. Frenzy AI is democratizing world-class AI for the other 99% of online retail and we need your help to reach more online businesses that will benefit from our 1:1 catalog personalization solution.


What you‚Äôll be working on?

Frenzy developed a revolutionary AI technology to help companies dramatically increase online sales by shortcutting shoppers to the exact product they're looking for in the fewest clicks possible via our first-party shopper data network. Some of our top clients include Simon Properties and Vestiaire Collective. Clients using Frenzy‚Äôs AI experience a 4x CVR and +30% revenue increase on average.


RESPONSIBILITIES

- Developing back-end applications, server infrastructure and system architecture

- Working on core Frenzy AI platform and building new API functionalities

- Develop retail-specific search, product recommendation and product discovery applications


REQUIREMENTS

  • Fluent in English
  • Complete our live coding assessment
  • Experience deploying applications on the cloud (AWS)
  • Experience in developing scalable APIs.
  • Experience with the following technologies:
  • Python - Flask/ Django. (MUST)
  • Search- Elasticsearch/Solr. (MUST)
  • ML- Image Object Detection and Classification, NLP- HMM, RNN, LSTM and GPT.
  • Databases- MySQL, Redis, AWS Dynamo (MUST)
  • Event Bus- AWS Firehose
  • Deployments- Docker, ECS (MUST)
  • Demonstrates expertise with the following cloud platforms:
  • AWS (MUST)


This Company Describes Its Culture as:

  • People-oriented -- supportive and fairness-focused
  • Outcome-oriented -- results-focused with strong performance culture
  • Motivated -- competitive and growth-oriented

Work Remotely:

  • Remote interview process

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
Job Title: Linux Administrator (Night Shift)

Location: Remote (EST Hours: 11 PM - 8 AM)


Our client is seeking an experienced Linux Administrator to join their team. This role is ideal for professionals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and have a strong background in Linux administration, automation, and AWS cloud services. The successful candidate will work during night shift hours (11 PM - 8 AM EST) to support critical systems and infrastructure.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Manage and maintain Linux environments, including RHEL 6/7/8/9, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu, and CentOS .
  • Work extensively with AWS services , particularly EC2, AMI, EBS, S3, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, and IAM .
  • Utilize Ansible or Ansible Automation Platform (AAP) to write and manage complex playbooks for automation.
  • Develop and maintain scripting solutions using Bash, Python, Terraform, and YAML to automate system tasks.
  • Administer and manage RedHat Satellite , overseeing master satellite server and capsule server infrastructure for a fleet of approximately 35 ships.
  • Support and troubleshoot file transfer protocols such as SFTP, FTP, FTPS, SCP, CIFS, SMB, and NFS .
  • Work with virtualization technologies like VMware and VMware Cloud (VMC) .
  • Configure and maintain web technologies, including HTTPD, Tomcat, and NGINX .
  • Utilize Git, GitLab, or GitHub for version control and code management.
  • Document processes and manage incidents using ServiceNow, Jira, and Confluence .
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams and provide 24/7 system support as required.


Required Skills & Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in Linux administration with strong troubleshooting skills.
  • Expertise in automation tools , particularly Ansible Tower/AAP .
  • Hands-on experience with AWS cloud services .
  • Strong scripting skills in Bash, Python, Terraform, and YAML .
  • Experience managing RedHat Satellite infrastructure .
  • Understanding of file transfer protocols and security best practices.
  • Experience working with virtualization and containerization technologies .
  • Strong documentation and communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently and take initiative in solving complex issues.


Nice to Have:

  • Experience with Docker and containerization technologies .
  • Familiarity with Morpheus Hybrid Cloud .
  • Knowledge of Tanium Endpoint Management .
  • Exposure to database technologies such as Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MySQL .


This is an excellent opportunity for a skilled Linux Administrator to work with cutting-edge technology in a dynamic environment. If you have a passion for automation, cloud infrastructure, and Linux systems, we encourage you to apply!

title: Application Security Engineer III
description:
Overview

When you think of InComm Payments, think of Innovative Payments Technology. We were founded over 30 years ago and continue to be a pioneer in the payment (FinTech) industry. Since our inception, we have grown to be a team of over 3,000 employees in 35 countries around the world. We own over 400 global technical patents and a network that includes over 525,000 points of retail distribution that points to our industry expertise.


We are creating nearly 200 Fully Remote jobs in Brazil for various financial technology (Fintech) engineering, database, development, and testing teams.


InComm Payments is highly focused on our people and their growth, and we work hard to make a career at InComm Payments meaningful and rewarding. We value innovation, quality, passion, integrity and responsibility in all that we do, and we are looking for great people to join our team as we move forward towards a very bright future. We anticipate developing future leaders for our teams in Brazil!


Benefits include health and dental insurance, meal and restaurant vouchers, fixed monthly stipend for internet and mobile expenses, InComm hardware/software, and annual bonuses! All positions are CLT.


You can learn more about InComm Payments by visiting our Website or connecting with us on , YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, or Instagram.


About This Opportunity

Our Global Enterprise Security Team is growing in Brazil and we are seeking a dedicated and experienced Senior Application Security Engineer to join our growing team! You will work with a dynamic group of professionals dispersed across North and South America supporting our global business that spans 5 continents. You will play a crucial part in safeguarding our applications from potential threats and vulnerabilities. With a few years of hands-on experience, you will conduct thorough security assessments, implement robust security measures, and ensure compliance with industry standards. Your strong analytical skills and deep understanding of modern security protocols and tools will be essential in identifying and mitigating risks early in the development lifecycle. You will report to the Enterprise Application Security group which works closely with software development and application ownership teams across various business units to help develop more secure applications and products. Join us as we secure applications and products across the entire InComm Payments enterprise!


CLT and fully remote position. Must reside in Brazil. Benefits include:

  • Health and dental insurance
  • Meal and restaurant vouchers
  • Fixed monthly stipend for internet and mobile expenses
  • Company-issued device


Responsibilities

  • Integrate SAST tooling into CI/CD pipelines, ensuring compatibility and efficient scanning within development workflows.
  • Provide tailored SAST integration support for development teams at varying maturity levels with diverse toolsets and security requirements.
  • Analyze application logs for anomalous patterns, communicate findings to leadership, and persuade them to take appropriate action.
  • Participate in on-call rotation in support of WAF incidents.
  • Validate security vulnerabilities identified by automated tools and fine-tune configurations to minimize false positives and reduce noise.
  • Develop threat models with development teams to help expose risks in their deliverables.
  • Participate in application design and architectural reviews.
  • Facilitate activities such as blue/red team events and bug bounty programs.
  • Lead prioritization discussions to gain traction on important security issues
  • Act as a liaison with 3rd parties performing vulnerability scans and penetration testing to validate findings and inform priorities and strategies for remediation.
  • Draft, evaluate, and monitor compliance with application and development security standards.
  • Ensure development teams are validating for OWASP Top 10 and performing industry leading application security practices.


Qualifications

  • 5+ years of application security experience.
  • Strong background with CI/CD processes and associated tooling, such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure Pipelines, or similar.
  • Strong scripting experience - PowerShell, Python, etc.
  • Extensive experience with SAST & DAST application scanning tools and knowledge of OWASP methodologies
  • Application security experience with high level programming languages (e.g., Java, C, C++, C#, VB, .NET, ASP.NET, ASP, PHP, J2EE, JSP)
  • Experience with Container technologies - Docker, Docker Swarm, Kubernetes
  • Experience with Cloud Service Providers (Azure and/or AWS)
  • Knowledge of Web Application Firewalls (WAF)
  • Experience with performing web, API, and mobile manual penetration testing; preparing reports to document findings; and presenting the report to development teams.
  • Familiarity with regulatory controls and industry best practices such as HIPAA, PCI, HiTrust, NIST etc.
  • Communication skills to create documentation, videos and conduct training classes
  • Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet established deadlines.
  • Ability to collaborate with IT teams on security-related tasks and projects.
  • Ability to work productively while remote and communicate effectively in a virtual team environment.
  • Ability to stay current with new technology.


Education & Certifications

  • Education: Associate Degree, or, Technologo (Technologist) Degree, or higher is required.
  • A CISSP certification is preferred, but not required. Career development plan to include certifications upon hire.


InComm Payments provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin, citizenship, veteran‚Äôs status, age, disability status, genetics or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law.


This position is eligible for the Employee Referral Bonus Program - Tier 4

title: Frontend Developer - Angular
description:
We Are Sportingtech:

Sportingtech is a multi-award-winning provider of turnkey betting and gaming solutions designed for regulated and emerging markets around the world. With offices in Malta, Bulgaria, London, Brazil and Portugal, our iGaming platform offers everything covering sportsbook, casino and retail via a modular system and intuitive back office for a fully omni-channel solution. Our unparalleled ability to cater for local-market customisation and operator preferences provides players with an optimal betting experience, resulting in proven growth for our rapidly expanding customer base.


Where you Fit In:

As a Senior Front-end Developer you‚Äôll become a part of our multinational Scrum teams to create state-of-the-art software solutions. In all teams we cooperate with internal and external experts from different knowledge domains to discover and build the best solutions possible.


The impact you will have:

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to participate in the front-end architecture definition.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while following best practices and coding standards.
  • Analyse and troubleshoot technical issues, providing solutions and improvements.
  • Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation to aid in code understanding, onboarding and future enhancements.
  • Work closely with team members, developers, and QA‚Äôs, to deliver high-quality software in a timely fashion.
  • Identify and implement performance enhancements, scalability improvements, and code optimizations.
  • Stay up to date with the latest front-end technologies and frameworks to recommend and implement the best solutions.
  • Participate in and conduct code reviews to ensure code quality and adherence to standards.
  • Implement security best practices and contribute to maintaining the security of applications.
  • Embrace agile development methodologies, such as Scrum or Kanban, to facilitate project delivery.


What we‚Äôre looking for:

  • Experience in Semantic HTML
  • Production ready implementation from mock-up
  • Javascript/Typescript development experience
  • Knowledge of Angular
  • Understanding of the W3C Web Design & Application standards
  • Knowledge of cross-platform Web & Mobile development and libraries
  • HTML
  • CSS/SCSS/SASS
  • Good spoken English


What we offer you:

  • Full-time employment under Brazilian CLT contract with competitive salary
  • Flexible work environment with plenty of learning and growth opportunities
  • Porto Seguro OuroMax Health Plan
  • Flash Card for meals and groceries ‚Äì R$ 1200/month
  • Porto Seguro Bronze 10 Dental Plan
  • MetLife Life Insurance
  • Birthday day-off
  • Access to O‚ÄôReilly Online Learning Platform


Sportingtech is an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and are committed to providing a work environment of mutual respect to everyone without regard to race, colour, religion, national origin, age, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: Data Analyst
description:
Onebridge is a Consulting firm with an HQ in Indianapolis, and clients dispersed throughout the United States and beyond. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly skilled Data Analyst to join an innovative and dynamic group of professionals at a company rated among the top ‚ÄúBest Places to Work‚Äù in Indianapolis since 2015.


Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote - Brazil

Industry: IT & Services, Data & Analytics, Healthcare.


Data Analyst | About You

As a Data Analyst, you focus on analyzing and interpreting data to provide insights that drive business decisions and improve system performance. You gather requirements from both internal teams and clients, identify data trends, and offer actionable recommendations. You are passionate about using data to solve business challenges, whether it‚Äôs identifying trends, troubleshooting data issues, or supporting decision-making processes. You bring strong analytical skills and attention to detail, ensuring data integrity and clarity in your reports.


Data Analyst | Day-to-Day

  • Analyze and interpret data to identify trends, anomalies, and insights that impact business processes and system performance.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues, working closely with clients and internal teams to ensure data accuracy.
  • Manage and resolve ServiceNow tickets related to data issues, ensuring timely resolution.
  • Gather data requirements from stakeholders, documenting them to ensure accurate reporting and analysis.
  • Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis, supporting better business decisions.


Data Analyst | Skills & Experience

  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Analyst, with expertise in data analysis and problem-solving.
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis.
  • Familiarity with ERP systems, ensuring smooth data flows between systems and business processes.
  • Fluent in English, with excellent communication skills to work with international clients and technical teams.
  • Experience with Tableau for creating reports and visualizations is a bonus.



A Best Place to Work in Indiana since 2015
