title: Expereince/Service Designer
description:
Level of Expertise: Senior / Specialist

Language requirements: Spanish with good oral communication skills and advanced English.

Region performance: Latam ‚Äì Brazil, Chile, Colombia or Mexico

Work format: Full Remote


Description

The Experience Designer for a global brand will enhance user experiences by merging design principles with in-depth user research methodologies. This position is dedicated to gaining insights into user needs, behaviors, and challenges, allowing for the development of innovative solutions that elevate services and products. The designer will actively drive initiatives, facilitate collaborative exercises, and engage in Product Discovery alongside the Product Team to foster continual improvement and creativity.


Main Skills: Service Design, User Research

Main Activities

¬∑ Conduct interviews, surveys, or shadowing to understand user needs and behaviors.

¬∑ Creating user personas/archetypes based on research findings to represent different user types.

¬∑ Mapping out user journeys to visualize user interactions and responses at various touchpoints.

¬∑ Developing service blueprints/experience to illustrate the service process, including frontstage and backstage activities.

¬∑ Planning and conducting experiments for different types of solutions.

¬∑ Testing solutions with real users to gather feedback and identify pain points.

¬∑ Facilitating co-creation workshops with stakeholders to brainstorm and refine service ideas.

¬∑ Synthesizing research findings into presentations and reports for stakeholders.


Main Deliverables

¬∑ User Research Report: executive summary of insights, findings, and/or recommendations.

¬∑ User Personas or Archetypes: representing different segments of the target audience.

¬∑ Customer Journey / Blueprints: visual documents that outline the steps users take when interacting with a service, including processes and user interactions.


Product Group that the person will work: Digital Customer Collaboration

Main Product Group areas: Supply chain, Customer Services

Product Summary: Digital Customer Collaboration wants to create sustainable financial health by empowering customers and businesses to make accurate purchasing decisions, knowing what and how much to buy, enabled by efficient and trusted delivery of their orders.

title: Analista de Comunica√ß√£o Interna Pleno
description:
About the company:

Avenue Code is the leading software consultancy focused on delivering end-to-end development solutions for digital transformation across every vertical. We‚Äôre privately held, profitable, and have been on a solid growth trajectory since day one. We care deeply about our clients, our partners, and our people. We prefer the word ‚Äòpartner‚Äô over ‚Äòvendor‚Äô, and our investment in professional relationships is a reflection of that philosophy. We pride ourselves on our technical acumen, our collaborative problem-solving ability, and the warm professionalism of our teams.

Avenue Code has been believing in and promoting plurality actions for over 10 years, understanding that recognizing differences and fostering a safe environment, employment opportunities, representation, and support are the best ways to promote an increasingly equitable culture.


About the opportunity:

You will be part of the communication team at the AI/R group, where Avenue is one of the group‚Äôs companies. You will work cross-functionally across all group companies, ensuring alignment in communication and culture.


Responsibilities:

  • Plan, develop, and execute internal communication campaigns that are aligned with the company‚Äôs strategic objectives, ensuring engagement and clarity across the organization.
  • Produce high-quality institutional content for various communication channels, including but not limited to emails, intranet, corporate TV, newsletters, and others, tailored to the needs of different internal audiences.
  • Organize and execute internal events and engagement activities, fostering a positive work environment and promoting employee connection with company goals and values.
  • Act as a communication consultant to strategic departments, providing support for communication needs in specific projects and initiatives across the organization.
  • Develop, track, and analyze internal communication KPIs to measure campaign effectiveness. Proactively suggest improvements and adjustments to enhance internal communication efforts continuously.
  • Ensure that internal communications reinforce and promote the company‚Äôs culture and values, helping employees feel aligned with the organization‚Äôs mission and vision.


Required Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in internal communications.
  • Strong writing and editing skills, with the ability to tailor content to different audiences.
  • Experience in planning and executing internal campaigns and events.
  • Familiarity with communication tools (e.g., email marketing, intranet platforms, TV corporate systems).
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with multiple departments and leaders.
  • Advanced English skills (writing and speaking).



Avenue Code reinforces its commitment to privacy and to all the principles guaranteed by the most accurate global data protection laws, such as GDPR, LGPD, CCPA and CPRA. The Candidate data shared with Avenue Code will be kept confidential and will not be transmitted to disinterested third parties, nor will it be used for purposes other than the application for open positions. As a Consultancy company, Avenue Code may share your information with its clients and other Companies from the CompassUol Group to which Avenue Code‚Äôs consultants are allocated to perform its services.

title: Senior Backend (LLM) Engineer
description:
About Us

Founded in 2019 by two best friends, Jon and Eli, XILO set out to revolutionize the insurance industry by solving its biggest challenges. Eli, a brokerage owner, brought invaluable industry expertise, while Jon, an experienced software engineer, saw an opportunity to innovate using technology. Initially launched as a vertical SaaS solution addressing core quoting challenges, XILO has since evolved into a trailblazing Vertical AI company leveraging the latest AI technology to transform the industry. By layering cutting-edge AI solutions onto its SaaS platform, XILO is driving innovation far beyond its original vision. Having recently closed our Series A funding round, XILO is growing rapidly and seeking talented individuals who want to do career-defining work in a mission-driven startup that‚Äôs at the forefront of AI innovation.


About The Role

You‚Äôll be designing and optimizing AI models, fine-tuning LLMs, OCR, and other AI-driven systems to streamline complex workflows and make insurance automation smarter, faster, and more reliable.

This isn‚Äôt just another ML role. We‚Äôre solving deep-rooted inefficiencies that insurance agencies have struggled with for decades‚Äîso much so that prospects have nearly teared up realizing how much time and effort our solutions will save them. Your work won‚Äôt be theoretical‚Äîit will directly transform the way thousands of businesses operate.


What You‚Äôll Do:

  • Architect and develop scalable TypeScript microservices powering XILO‚Äôs platform.
  • Design and optimize workflows for AI-driven customer interactions with the help of integration and fine tuning LLMs.
  • Prepare datasets for LLM fine-tuning.
  • Optimize system performance, reliability, and scalability.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams (product, frontend, data science) to deliver seamless integrations.
  • Mentor and guide junior engineers, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented team culture.
  • Implement best practices for API security, data privacy, and maintainability.


What we‚Äôre looking for

  • 7+ years of backend engineering experience, with at least 2 years of expertise in TypeScript/Node.js.
  • Deep understanding of microservices architecture and cloud-based deployment (AWS, Heroku).
  • Deep understanding of Postgres database architecture and design.
  • Proven experience with scalable API design and database optimization.
  • Experience in fine-tuning and integration with LLMs (ChatGPT, ClaudeAI, Llama, etc.)
  • Experience in gathering datasets for LLM fine-tuning.
  • Passion for writing clean, maintainable, and testable code.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment.
  • A collaborative mindset with a willingness to mentor and learn from others.


What we offer

  • Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  • Flex PTO for any reason, including sick days (no specified limits), flexible work schedule.
  • Personal laptop.
  • Health and wellness package.
  • Budget for English lessons.


You‚Äôll have the opportunity to specialize in:

  • AI Agents ‚Äì The core of our automation strategy, building AI-driven workflows that replace tedious, manual processes with seamless decision-making
  • LLM & Model Fine-Tuning ‚Äì Adapting models to understand and process insurance-specific language and workflows with high accuracy
  • OCR & Document Intelligence ‚Äì Extracting, structuring, and analyzing critical insights from a wide range of insurance documents
  • Intelligent Data Mapping ‚Äì Training models to aggregate, categorize, and link scattered data into a centralized, dynamic user profile


Why Join XILO?

  • A great tech startup ‚Äì Small, fast-moving, and driven by real impact
  • Endless career growth ‚Äì Help shape the team, tech, and company as we scale
  • Strong leadership & backing ‚Äì Work alongside experienced founders and tier 1 silicon-valley VCs
  • Real-world data at scale ‚Äì Work with rich, high-quality datasets collected from hundreds of insurance agencies , providing a strong foundation for AI fine- tuning, automation, and decision-making models

title: Entry Level Recruiter (Dutch Speaker)
description:
We are looking for a passionate and motivated Entry Level Recruiter to support our recruitment efforts in the Netherlands market.

Mandatory Requirement: Fluency in Dutch and English

This is going to be 100% remote job and we are only considering PJ.

Responsibilities:

Source and screen candidates for various roles.

Conduct initial interviews and assessments.

Coordinate and schedule interviews with hiring managers.

Assist in developing and posting job advertisements.

Maintain candidate databases and track recruitment metrics.

Provide excellent candidate experience throughout the recruitment process.

Requirements:

Fluency in Dutch and English (both written and spoken).

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to multitask and manage time effectively.

Keen interest in the recruitment and talent acquisition field.

Basic knowledge of recruitment tools and techniques is a plus.

title: Social Worker
description:
**This job is in Ireland - you must be fluent in English - we can only accept applications from fully qualified social workers who are willing to relocate to Ireland - we will coordinate all visas, work permits etc**


GS International Recruitment is looking for a highly skilled and experienced Social Care Worker who will work with children/ young people, families and/ or significant others, Social Work teams, other healthcare providers agencies, schools, training agencies and community groups.


The Social Care Worker will care for, protect, and support vulnerable or dependent clients, individually or in groups, in conjunction with the wider multidisciplinary team and other relevant agencies. She/ he will ensure the welfare of those under his/ her care and will act as an advocate as appropriate.


The Social Care Worker will contribute to the planning and evaluation of individualised and group programmes of care, which are based on needs, identified in consultation with the client and others and delivered through day-to-day shared life experiences.


Within the Residential and Special Care Setting , the Social Care Worker will work as part of a team to provide a safe, caring environment for resident children/ young people with the primary aim of providing the intervention necessary to address the issues that are preventing them from living at home or in foster care, or to prepare them to live independently with the support of aftercare services.


Key Responsibilities:


Care and Support:

  • Ability to treat children/young people and their families with dignity, respect, and unconditional positive regard.
  • Plan, implement, and evaluate care plans, placement plans, and treatment programs.
  • Incorporate understanding of how previous life experiences impact children/young people into practice.
  • Engage in crisis management and physical intervention as per policy (e.g., Therapeutic Crisis Intervention).


Family and Community Engagement:

  • Work collaboratively with parents, families, and other agencies on behalf of the child/young person.
  • Participate in meetings regarding the care and development of children/young people.
  • Provide verbal and written feedback on the progress of children/young people.


Supportive and Advocacy:

  • Promote the rights, responsibilities, and welfare (physical, emotional, social, cultural, ethnic, spiritual) of each child/young person.
  • Encourage and support children/young people in community and family settings.
  • Form relationships and engage with traumatized children/young people.
  • Be a positive role model and advocate for children/young people's well-being.


Organizational and Management:

  • Undertake home management tasks such as budgeting, upkeep, cleaning, and hygiene.
  • Organize personal documents, information, and finances on behalf of children/young people.
  • Arrange age-appropriate activities and ensure the safety and risk assessment of children/young people on-site and during outings.


Educational and Developmental Support:

  • Promote attendance at school, training centers, medical, and clinical appointments.
  • Engage in age-appropriate play and activities with children/young persons.
  • Assist with transfer/referral to other services as needed.


Safety and Crisis Management:

  • Supervise children/young people during outings and maintain safety protocols.
  • Remain calm and manage oneself during volatile or potentially violent situations.
  • Report and respond to incidents promptly, including cases of absconding or abuse prevention.

The above Job Description is not intended to be a comprehensive list of all duties involved and consequently, the post holder may be required to perform other duties as appropriate to the post which may be assigned to him/her from time to time and to contribute to the development of the post while in office.

Must be willing to relocate to Ireland



Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Social Work, Psychology, Sociology, or related field (preferred).
  • More than 5 years of experience working in a residential care setting or with children and young people in a supportive capacity.
  • Knowledge of child development, trauma-informed care, and therapeutic interventions.
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to build rapport and trust with residents and their families.
  • Ability to work effectively within a multidisciplinary team and collaborate with external agencies.
  • Commitment to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children and young people.


Alternatively, please contact Rendy Mfene at if you have any questions!

title: Chatbot Engineer
description:
The Chatbot Engineer at Avenue Code will focus on developing and configuring conversational flows within the Google Dialogflow platform. They will be responsible for designing and implementing intents, entities, context management, and the overall dialogue logic to guide the end user. This role involves setting up webhook calls from Dialogflow to integration points (such as Cloud Functions) that will execute the business logic. The engineer will work closely with the Node.js Engineer to define and validate the interfaces/contracts for these integrations.


Essential Skills:

  • Hands-on experience in developing and configuring conversational flows in commercial platforms, with a strong preference for Google Dialogflow.
  • Deep knowledge of conversational design: intents, entities, context management, fallback handling, and response strategies.
  • Experience configuring webhook calls from Dialogflow to external services.
  • Ability to map business requirements into effective dialogue flows.
  • Capability to collaborate with back-end engineers to define API/integration contracts.


Desirable Skills:

  • Basic programming knowledge (e.g., Node.js, Python) to understand webhook logic.
  • Experience with messaging platforms, especially WhatsApp Business API.
  • Familiarity with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts.
  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
  • Knowledge of version control tools like Git.

title: ServiceNow Support Analyst
description:
Job Title: ServiceNow Support Analyst

Employment Type: Contract

Compensation (average salary in Brazilian currency):

  • Junior Level: R$ 78-89/h (0‚Äì2 years of experience)
  • Mid Level: R$ 89-101/h (3‚Äì5 years of experience)
  • Senior Level: R$ 112-123/h (5+ years of experience)

Location: Remote


Overview

Our cliente is seeking a detail-oriented and service-driven ServiceNow Support Analyst . In this role, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality technical and functional support for the ServiceNow platform. You will serve as a frontline contact for end users, troubleshoot platform-related issues, and help maintain and enhance the system‚Äôs performance and usability. This is an excellent opportunity for professionals passionate about ITSM tools and customer support to contribute meaningfully in a dynamic and collaborative environment.


Key Responsibilities

  • Act as the primary point of contact for ServiceNow-related inquiries, incidents, and service requests.
  • Provide support through various channels including phone, email, and service portals, ensuring timely and accurate issue resolution.
  • Troubleshoot technical issues within ServiceNow, perform root cause analysis, and escalate when necessary.
  • Assist users with ServiceNow navigation, features, and capabilities; provide training and guidance as needed.
  • Execute basic administrative and configuration tasks such as user provisioning, password resets, and data updates under the guidance of senior staff.
  • Monitor system performance and proactively identify potential issues or bottlenecks.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional IT teams to implement system updates, bug fixes, and enhancements.
  • Participate in testing of new features and updates prior to deployment.
  • Maintain accurate documentation, including support guides, troubleshooting steps, and FAQs.
  • Support change, incident, and problem management processes in alignment with ITIL practices.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives to optimize the ServiceNow environment and user experience.
  • Stay informed on new ServiceNow releases and best practices to ensure up-to-date support and advice.


Qualifications

  • 0‚Äì2 years (Jr), 3‚Äì5 years (Mid), or 5+ years (Sr) of hands-on experience supporting ServiceNow or similar ITSM platforms.
  • Familiarity with ServiceNow modules such as Incident Management, Request Management, Knowledge Base, and User Administration.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
  • Excellent communication and customer service abilities.
  • Ability to work independently and in a collaborative team environment.
  • Exposure to ITIL framework and best practices preferred.
  • ServiceNow certifications (e.g., CSA) are a plus.

title: Country Manager

title: Trade Finance Professionals
description:
About the Role:

Euro Exim Bank, an award-winning global financial institution is seeking freelance-based professionals who are truly Passionate About Sales. Your main task is to attract new clients involved in international trade such as exporters and importers by offering them our trade finance services such as Letters of Credit, Standby Letters of Credit and Bank Guarantees necessary for them to trade successfully in the global market.


Freelance basis only (this is NOT a permanent position)

Commission-based pay only (this is NOT a fixed salaried position)

Working from home from your country of residence (this is NOT an office-based position)

There is NO investment or fee required from you.


Benefits:

Working in your own leisure time at your own pace where there are no targets.

Setting your own goals, and your success is only limited by your enthusiasm and dedication to winning deals and bringing sales.

Ability to bring own clients and contacts to earn higher commissions.

Expand your professional network

Ongoing delivery of high-quality training and trade finance product knowledge

All members of our global sales team are given a commission scheme ranging from 6.5% to 15% on successful transaction volumes (terms & conditions apply). Your commission earnings will increase with your performance growth.

title: Senior Full Stack UI Developer ‚Äì Angular, TypeScript & API Expert
description:
Job Title: Senior Full Stack UI Developer ‚Äì Angular, TypeScript & API Expert

Position Type: Full-Time Contract (40hrs/week)

Contract Duration: Long Term

Work Hours: Central Time Zone (CST)

Work Schedule: 8 hours/day (Mon-Fri)

Location: 100% Remote (Candidates can from from anywhere in LATAM Countries)

Overview

We're seeking a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our client's RealTime team. This role is ideal for someone passionate about real-time web applications, data visualization, and working in a distributed team environment. You will contribute to the development of cloud-based, real-time applications that display fracking job data and global site visualizations.

This position emphasizes Angular and TypeScript for the front end, with supporting backend development using .NET 6.0/C# and microservices architecture. Familiarity with real-time processing , Plotly charts , and messaging protocols (MQTT, RabbitMQ, SignalR) is highly desirable.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain responsive web applications using Angular and TypeScript
  • Write microservices and APIs using .NET 6.0 and C#
  • Integrate and troubleshoot messaging platforms such as MQTT , RabbitMQ , and Azure Service Bus
  • Work with MongoDB and manage JSON data models
  • Develop and visualize data using Plotly.js charts
  • Use Protobuf and SignalR/WebSockets for real-time communication
  • Write unit tests and participate in Agile/Scrum ceremonies
  • Collaborate across onshore and offshore teams , with daily Scrum meetings at 9 AM CST
  • Use Git and Azure DevOps for version control, CI/CD, and task tracking
  • Assist teammates and participate in code reviews and process improvement

Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in full stack development
  • Strong frontend experience with Angular, TypeScript, Plotly (70% frontend)
  • Solid backend skills with .NET 5.0 or 6.0 , C# , microservices, and APIs
  • Hands-on experience with real-time systems , SignalR , MQTT , or RabbitMQ
  • Familiarity with MongoDB or other non-relational databases
  • Strong skills working with JSON , Protobuf , and cloud-based real-time data
  • Experience in Agile/Scrum development environments
  • Strong communication skills; ability to work with distributed teams
  • Able to work independently and take initiative

Nice to Have

  • Experience with real-time geo-location data
  • Background in energy, fracking, or industrial data monitoring
  • Understanding of cloud data ingestion and real-time analytics
  • Experience working across time zones and multicultural teams

title: Recruitment Consultant
description:
Company Overview: AMX Healthcare is a leading national workforce solutions provider committed to connecting talented healthcare professionals with exceptional career opportunities. We're driven by innovation, technology, and a supportive, dynamic culture that fosters personal and professional growth.


Role Summary: The Recruiter will be responsible for conducting high-volume candidate outreach via telephone, screening healthcare professionals for both temporary and permanent assignments, effectively selling job opportunities, retrieving essential compliance documentation, and accurately updating our Applicant Tracking System (ATS). The ideal candidate will thrive in a fast-paced environment, be comfortable with high call volumes, and excel at building lasting relationships with healthcare professionals.


High-Volume Candidate Outreach:

  • Conduct 100+ outbound calls per day to prospective healthcare candidates.
  • Screen and qualify candidates effectively, matching their skills and interests to available job opportunities.
  • Clearly communicate job descriptions, assignment details, and benefits to candidates to generate interest.


Relationship Building & Candidate Management:

  • Establish strong relationships with candidates through consistent and professional communication.
  • Proactively follow up with candidates throughout the recruitment process to maintain engagement and commitment.
  • Actively manage and nurture candidate pipelines for future opportunities.


Compliance & Documentation:

  • Obtain and verify job-specific compliance documents, including licenses, credentials, and background check information.
  • Ensure candidates meet all compliance requirements prior to placement.
  • Maintain up-to-date and accurate compliance documentation within the ATS.


Applicant Tracking System (ATS) Management:

  • Accurately enter and update candidate details, communications, and compliance information within the ATS.
  • Regularly audit ATS records to ensure completeness and accuracy.


Performance & Target Achievement:

  • Consistently meet or exceed daily and weekly activity targets for calls, screenings, candidate submissions, and compliance completion.
  • Monitor recruitment metrics and suggest process improvements to enhance productivity and effectiveness.


Qualifications:

  • Proven experience in recruitment, high-volume candidate sourcing, telemarketing, or related roles.
  • Excellent telephone communication skills and confidence handling high call volumes daily.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize effectively.
  • Familiarity with ATS platforms and compliance processes in healthcare recruitment.


Skills & Attributes:

  • Results-driven, motivated, and capable of working independently and collaboratively.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills for engaging with candidates and colleagues.
  • Detail-oriented with strong administrative skills, ensuring accuracy in documentation and data entry.
  • Resilient, adaptable, and comfortable managing a fast-paced recruitment pipeline.


What We Offer:

  • Competitive base salary with extremely attractive commission scheme.
  • Comprehensive training and ongoing professional development.
  • An energetic, supportive team environment.
  • Opportunities for career growth within AMX Healthcare.
  • All paid trips abroad for top performers

title: Machine Learning Engineer | Sponsor US H1B
description:
Project Overview:

We are seeking a highly skilled and versatile Machine Learning and Data Engineer to join our team. This role involves developing sophisticated image-based solutions for plant phenotyping and pulling, stitching, and wrangling data from various sources for advanced analytics. The successful candidate will work on a cross-functional team, collaborating closely with crop scientists, plant pathologists, cloud engineers, and data scientists to enable access to relevant data and deploy machine-learning models and solutions.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement image-based solutions for quantifying various traits and features of plants.
  • Pull data from first and third-party sources, prepare it for analysis by filtering, tagging, joining, parsing, and normalizing datasets.
  • Collaborate with team members to research data sources, design and deploy data loaders, and ensure the availability of data for analytical activities.

title: Financial Sr Analyst (USD - Remote)
description:
Location: Remote

Working hours: Full Time

Overview

We are looking for a highly analytical and detail-oriented Financial Analyst to join a fast-growing, remote-first consumer goods company in the pet industry. This is an individual contributor role focused on building and refining Excel-based financial models and analytics. You will work directly with the Finance team supporting the entire organization (sales, marketing and operations). The role is ideal for someone who enjoys getting deep into data, spotting trends, forecasting ahead and creating the tools that support strategic decision-making.


Key Responsibilities

  • Build, maintain, and optimize Excel-based financial models , including sales forecasting by SKU, customer, and category.
  • Support budgeting and forecasting processes by analyzing past performance and future trends.
  • Prepare and refine custom templates to improve financial reporting and visibility.
  • Conduct deep-dive analyses to inform business decisions and highlight risks or opportunities.
  • Assist in financial data consolidation and participate in internal reporting discussions, including board presentations.
  • Help identify and implement process improvements and best practices across financial planning effort

  • Experience working with financial models (especially sales models or revenue forecasts).

  • Strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to spotting discrepancies and improving models.
  • Excellent communication skills and the ability to provide insights to non-finance stakeholders.

Nice to Have

  • Experience working in a remote-first team and managing asynchronous communication effectively.
  • Background in financial consulting or supporting board-level reporting .

title: Adaptive Packaging Designer for Global CPG Brand
description:
Overview:

We are seeking a Senior Adaptive Designer to support a global CPG brand with a packaging adaptation project . This role will focus on adapting global design templates for packaging in global markets while ensuring regional compliance, print accuracy, and multi-language requirements. The designer will work closely with internal teams, the repro agency, and print suppliers to maintain consistency and accuracy across a large number of SKUs and artworks.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Adapt global design templates to market-specific packaging needs, ensuring regional compliance.
  • Modify artwork for multi-language variants, SKU differentiation, and local market requirements.
  • Ensure print specifications, spot varnishes, color accuracy, and dielines are correctly applied.
  • Work within Adobe Illustrator to prepare high-quality, production-ready files.
  • Collaborate with regional marketing teams and packaging suppliers to implement changes efficiently.
  • Review files with production teams to ensure quality control before print.
  • Maintain organization of packaging files and templates for future adaptations.


Ideal Candidate Profile:

  • Experience with adaptive packaging design in global markets .
  • Expertise in Adobe Illustrator , including layered file management and print production workflows.
  • Prior experience with multi-language packaging , particularly text formatting and regional compliance.
  • Strong understanding of print production workflows , including collaboration with repro agencies , color management (PMS colors), and substrate layers .
  • Detail-oriented and proactive , ensuring designs meet print specifications while optimizing workflow efficiency.
  • Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and collaborate across teams.
  • Attention to detail ‚Äîensuring precision in technical specifications.


Ideal Candidate Profile:

  • Highly technical with strong print and packaging experience.
  • Comfortable working in structured template-driven projects rather than conceptual design.
  • Familiar with global regulatory requirements for packaging design.
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and proactive in problem-solving.


Work Structure & Next Steps:

Start Date: Late May/Early June

Duration: likely 8 weeks, with potential for extension based on project needs.

Time Commitment: Full-time

Communication: Primary collaboration via Teams, SharePoint, and Wrike.

title: Senior Backend Node.js Engineer
description:
Company Overview: Lean Tech is a rapidly expanding organization situated in Medell√≠n, Colombia. We pride ourselves on possessing one of the most influential networks within software development and IT services for the entertainment, financial, and logistics sectors. Our corporate projections offer a multitude of opportunities for professionals to elevate their careers and experience substantial growth. Joining our team means engaging with expansive engineering teams across Latin America and the United States, contributing to cutting-edge developments in multiple industries. Currently, we are seeking a Senior Back End Developer with a strong English level to join our team. Here are the challenges that our next warrior will face and the requirements we look for:


Position Title: Senior Back End Node.js Developer

Location: LATAM - Remote



What you will be doing: The Senior Backend Developer will lead the development and optimization of scalable, secure backend systems using serverless AWS architecture. The role involves building and maintaining critical backend services, including APIs, databases, and microservices, while collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful solutions.

  • Design, develop, and maintain serverless backend systems using Node.js and various AWS services (Lambda, DynamoDB, ECS, RDS).
  • Implement and optimize microservices architecture to enhance scalability, performance, and reliability.
  • Perform software analysis, integration and unit testing, debugging and code enhancements ensuring code completion, routinely inspect code for optimization opportunities.
  • Support request within our ticketing systems to ensure the timely delivery of development and or processing of failed transactions.
  • Develop APIs (GraphQL) to support application features.
  • Leverage CI/CD pipelines practices to ensure efficient deployment and integration.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code while adhering to coding standards.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and enhance application performance and stability.
  • Collaborate with frontend, DevOps, and other engineering teams to define and implement new features.
  • Stay updated on emerging technologies and contribute ideas to improve the tech stack.


Requirements & Qualifications:

  • Extensive experience as a Backend Developer, with a strong focus on Node.js and JavaScript.
  • Hands-on experience with AWS services, including Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, ECS, S3, and RDS.
  • Strong understanding of serverless architecture, event-driven design, and microservices. (AWS Serverless Model, AWS Amplify and AWS Chalice)
  • Experience with both SQL and NoSQL databases.
  • Proficiency in version control tools (e.g. GitHub/GitLab).
  • Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and automation tools.
  • Experience with Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, and CloudFormation.
  • Understanding of serverless identity management (AWS Cognito) and authentication/authorization practices.
  • Knowledge of modern software development methodologies (e.g., Agile, Waterfall).


Good to have:

  • Ability to work with frontend technologies like React.js is a plus.
  • Familiarity with TypeScript(1), Python(2), or Java(3) is a plus.
  • Experience with React development


Soft Skills:

  • Strong leadership abilities with excellent organizational and prioritization skills.
  • Outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to work independently as well as within a collaborative team environment.
  • Adaptable, proactive, and committed to continuous learning and improvement.


Why you will love Lean Tech:

  • Join a powerful tech workforce and help us change the world through technology.
  • Professional development opportunities with international customers.
  • Collaborative work environment.
  • Career path and mentorship programs that will lead to new levels.


Join Lean Tech and contribute to shaping the data landscape within a dynamic and growing organization. Your skills will be honed, and your contributions will be vital to our continued success. Lean Tech is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Ad Ops - CTV
description:
Responsibilities:

‚óè Campaign QA and Validation: Ensure that all ad campaigns meet client specifications, including

proper setup of tracking URLs, targeting parameters, and creative assets, third-party Tags before

launch.

‚óè Compliance and Error Checks: Conduct thorough checks for compliance with platform policies,

client-specific advertiser guidelines, and technical requirements to identify and rectify any errors.

‚óè Performance Monitoring: Regularly monitor live campaigns to ensure accurate tracking, pacing, and delivery, addressing any discrepancies promptly.

‚óè Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed QA reports, document findings, and provide

actionable insights to improve workflow efficiency and campaign accuracy.

‚óè Process Optimization: Work closely with the trafficking, account management, and creative teams to streamline QA processes, minimize errors, and ensure seamless campaign execution.

‚óè Creative Testing for CTV Devices: Perform thorough testing of creative assets across Connected TV (CTV) devices to ensure proper functionality, quality, and compliance with platform requirements

‚óè Campaign Trafficking and QA: Effectively traffic and QA various campaign types, including CPM and CPCV, ensuring accurate setup and adherence to delivery goals.

‚óè Boolean Logic Implementation: Proficient in applying Boolean logic (AND, OR statements) for precise targeting and effective campaign optimization

title: Ad Ops - CTV
description:
Responsibilities:

‚óè Campaign QA and Validation: Ensure that all ad campaigns meet client specifications, including

proper setup of tracking URLs, targeting parameters, and creative assets, third-party Tags before

launch.

‚óè Compliance and Error Checks: Conduct thorough checks for compliance with platform policies,

client-specific advertiser guidelines, and technical requirements to identify and rectify any errors.

‚óè Performance Monitoring: Regularly monitor live campaigns to ensure accurate tracking, pacing, and delivery, addressing any discrepancies promptly.

‚óè Documentation and Reporting: Maintain detailed QA reports, document findings, and provide

actionable insights to improve workflow efficiency and campaign accuracy.

‚óè Process Optimization: Work closely with the trafficking, account management, and creative teams to streamline QA processes, minimize errors, and ensure seamless campaign execution.

‚óè Creative Testing for CTV Devices: Perform thorough testing of creative assets across Connected TV (CTV) devices to ensure proper functionality, quality, and compliance with platform requirements

‚óè Campaign Trafficking and QA: Effectively traffic and QA various campaign types, including CPM and CPCV, ensuring accurate setup and adherence to delivery goals.

‚óè Boolean Logic Implementation: Proficient in applying Boolean logic (AND, OR statements) for precise targeting and effective campaign optimization

title: Power Bi Developer
description:
We are HCLTech, one of the world‚Äôs largest and fastest growing technology and DSA companies with over 227,000 professionals across 60 countries, driving progress through industry-leading capabilities focused on Digital, Engineering and Cloud.


The driving force behind this work, our people, is a diverse, creative and passionate audience that enables us to continually raise the bar for excellence in our services. We strive to empower each of our professionals to achieve their best, while also striving to help them find their daily inspiration and become the best version of themselves.


We are looking for a highly talented and self-motivated to join us on our journey to advance the world of technology through innovation and creativity.


Job Description:

  • Experience in Power BI Services and administration.
  • Good knowledge of Power BI report development, Power BI Services, Workspace, Access Management and Capacity Management.
  • Hands on experience in DAX and SQL.
  • Experience in handling tickets, incidents etc. through Service Now or any other tool.
  • Must have effective communication skills and should have worked with business and customers for their reporting requirements
  • To develop and deliver detailed solutions or products as per the requirements of the client within defined parameters of time and quality.


Why choose us?

We are one of the largest and fastest growing technology companies in the world, with offices in over 60 countries and 224,000 employees

Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented

We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues from all over the world

We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good integration between your work and personal life, with real flexibility

We are committed to your growth, offering learning and career development opportunities at all levels to help you find your unique brilliance. We offer comprehensive benefits to all employees

We are certified as a "Great Place to Work" and "Top Employer" in 17 countries, and recognized as a ‚ÄúTop Employer‚Äù in Brazil specifically, offering a positive work environment that values employee recognition and respect


Equality & Opportunity for All

Representing 165 nationalities worldwide, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, disability or genetic information, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state and/or local laws

title: Cloud Engineer - Azure
description:
We are looking for a Cloud Engineer to work together with our team members on our enterprise customer projects. This is a well-paid remote role that you can do from anywhere.


Responsibilities

  • Be part of a team managing and monitoring all deployed systems and infrastructure in our customer environments
  • Automate deployments on complex and custom software solutions
  • Proactively ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability
  • Monitor and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions and work with developers to implement those fixes
  • Maintain security, backup, and redundancy strategies
  • Engage in design discussions together with internal and external stakeholders
  • Participate in pre-sale activities occasionally


Your profile

  • 5+ years of Azure experience
  • 3+ years of Terraform experience
  • 5+ years of Docker and Kubernetes experience
  • 2+ years of Ansible experience
  • 2+ years of GitOps experience
  • Understanding of Git-flow
  • Strong Systems Engineering background
  • Infrastructure and network security knowledge
  • ‚ÄúAutomate everything‚Äù-mentality
  • Experience working on large-scale Azure projects
  • Deep knowledge of both Linux and Windows Server operating systems
  • Understanding of Identity and Access Management
  • Excellent English ‚Äì written and verbal
  • Service-oriented and customer-centric mindset
  • Great level of autonomy


Nice to have

  • AWS experience.
  • Kubernetes Helm Chart development experience
  • Terraform Associate (Certification)
  • Azure AZ-104 (Certification)
  • Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) Certification



If this role excites you, but you are worried that you don't fit all the requirements, please send your application anyway. We would love to get in touch!

title: Multi-platform Ads Specialist
description:
We are hiring: Multi-platform Ads Specialist


Do you have a passion for data and digital advertising? Are you experienced in running campaigns across platforms like Facebook, Google, TikTok, and more? If yes, we‚Äôd love to meet you.


About the Role

As a Multi-platform Ads Specialist, you will be responsible for planning, executing, optimizing, and reporting on paid campaigns across various digital platforms to support our business and client growth goals.


Key Responsibilities

  • Plan and manage paid ad campaigns on platforms such as Facebook Ads, Google Ads, TikTok Ads, Zalo Ads, and others
  • Analyze campaign data and performance to provide actionable insights and optimization strategies
  • Collaborate with content, design, and development teams to ensure ad effectiveness
  • Stay updated on industry trends and experiment with new ad formats and strategies


Requirements

  • 1‚Äì2 years of experience managing multi-platform paid ads
  • Solid understanding of performance metrics such as CTR, CPA, ROAS, etc.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with tools like Google Analytics or similar
  • Growth mindset with adaptability to new platforms and changes
  • Experience in (Retail/Fashion/Education/Tech) industry is a plus


What We Offer

  • Competitive salary and performance-based bonuses
  • A young, dynamic, and creative working environment
  • Opportunities to work with a wide range of clients and industries
  • Access to training and professional development support

#Hiring #DigitalMarketing #PerformanceMarketing #AdsSpecialist #FacebookAds #GoogleAds #TikTokAds #MarketingCareers

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
Sync is a personal assistant for diabetes that helps people make the best decisions by unifying health data and making daily management more practical, faster, and more accurate. Our app consolidates glucose measurements, insulin injections, carb counting, and many other health metrics in one place.


We are a small, early-stage startup of 10 experienced people looking for a Staff Software Engineer to help lead and scale our technology.


What You‚Äôll Do


Architect and Develop - Work with our NestJS backend, Flutter mobile app, and Google Cloud infrastructure to deliver a robust, high-quality product.


Observability & Monitoring - Set up and maintain monitoring and alerting with Sentry (for errors) and Grafana (for infrastructure), ensuring performance and reliability.


Technical Leadership - Define best practices, lead code reviews, guide system architecture decisions, and maintain a high bar for code quality and performance.


Process & Team Growth - Proactively improve development processes (CI/CD, Agile workflows), support hiring, and help define on-call procedures.


Ownership & Autonomy - Drive initiatives from ideation to production, influencing the tech culture and strategic direction of the company.


What We‚Äôre Looking For


Extensive Experience - Proven track record in a senior/staff engineering role, preferably in startup or scale-up environments.


Adaptability & Learning : Comfortable learning new technologies and frameworks quickly. While we use NestJS, Flutter, and Google Cloud, we value strong fundamentals more than specific framework knowledge.


Monitoring & Observability - Comfortable with tools like Grafana, Sentry, and other metrics/logging solutions.


Leadership & Communication - History of mentoring engineers, improving team processes, and collaborating cross-functionally.


Proactive & Collaborative - Able to identify challenges, propose solutions, and rally the team toward common goals.


What We Offer


Remote-First - Work from anywhere with flexibility in schedules.


Competitive Compensation - Attractive salary package plus equity .


Growth Opportunities - Be part of an early-stage startup where you can directly impact product and culture.


Meaningful Work - Help build a solution that genuinely improves the lives of people living with diabetes.


Supportive Culture - A collaborative environment that values initiative, ownership, and continuous learning.

title: Calypso Functional FO-MO
description:
Project Description:

Luxoft has one of the world's leading Calypso practices.

We are a top-tier Calypso Partner and a market leader in implementation, integration, upgrade, and migration.

We provide end-to-end project services and have delivered Calypso projects across all major asset classes and sectors including investment banking, asset management, corporate treasury, and insurance.


Project Description:

Support and additional build out (projects) for Calypso instance.


Responsibilities:

- Address and respond to production support issues and trouble shoot issues arising from day-to-day activities Calypso instance

- Provide support to FO and MO users on Calypso

- Configure, updated, optimize functional set up in Calypso

- Execute (where required) SOD/ EOD Scheduled Tasks

- Develop necessary functional solutions for Calypso instance as per requirements (if required)

- Monitor if market quotes fail to update Calypso system error messages

- Monitor feed & security definitions download, if reprocessing of trades needed or reprocessing of events

- Ensures supporting documents are complete, current, and appropriately stored

- Works closely with relevant business and technology stakeholders to ensure effective and efficient implementation of the project(s)

- Submits status reports to stakeholders; coordinates and provides updates to steering committees

- Collaboration with key functional or business stakeholders to achieve clear outcomes/deliverables in relation to the strategic and transformational book of work

- Manage deliverables ensuring transparency of risks, issues and dependencies that are fully aligned to functional / business owners


You might be acting also as a business analyst as well in order to help the team gathering and writing requirements, acceptance criteria.


A Sampling of Tasks Expected to be Performed:

1. Configuring Standard & Custom Interfaces within Calypso

2. Setting up Quote Feeds from Bloomberg

3. Set-up Holiday Calendar feed

4. Set-up Interest Rate Curves & other market data

5. Set-up Dividend Curves for Custom Index

6. Set-up Equity Volatility Surface feeds

7. Translate Historical Volatility of Volatility-controlled indexes to a Volatility Surface to be used in Calypso

8. Set-up pricing configuration & pricing parameters

9. Some end-of-day processing/monitoring needed


Skills Description:

‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience working in Capital Markets and Calypso

‚Ä¢ Good knowledge of Financial products cross assets

- Expertise with a front-to-back Calypso derivatives solution, including accounting, is a must. Preferably with an insurance

industry focus.


Other Required Skills:

- Ability to work with little supervision, be a fast learner, self-motivated, team player, and collaborator with strong problem-solving

skills.

- Must be resourceful and demonstrate initiative in getting the job done.

- Good oral and written communication skills are essential.


- Ability to train and transfer knowledge to Guardian's business and technology stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Proven track record of delivery of implementation / migration projects

‚Ä¢ Proven experience in the development of Calypso integrations, reporting, and other technical aspects

- Experience of adherence to governance frameworks / implementation and handover to BAU

‚Ä¢ Comprehensive knowledge of trade flow, trading systems and related concepts and technology, including valuation and client/market risk management

‚Ä¢ Leadership skills

‚Ä¢ Excellent analytical skills, understanding of project life cycles, and ability to act in an entrepreneurial manner to ensure the requirements from the business are gathered in the appropriate manner.

‚Ä¢ Proven analytical, planning, problem solving and decision-making skills

‚Ä¢ Comfortable with direct communication with all levels of technical and business resources

‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously

‚Ä¢ Experience with working in a highly collaborative and dynamic multi-team environment

title: Software Engineer
description:
Joing FlyingPenguins as a software engineer


Are you a skilled, driven engineer passionate about creating meaningful online learning experiences? Want to shape how individuals and teams develop critical collaboration skills in the workplace? Then come soar with us at FlyingPenguins !


Who we are

At FlyingPenguins, we‚Äôre revolutionizing collaboration through AI-enabled, facilitator-led learning experiences . Our research-backed, interactive platform helps individuals and teams improve how they collaborate‚Äîmaking real change in modern workplaces.


We‚Äôre now building our core online platform , the heart of our learning ecosystem, and we need your help to make it exceptional.


What you will do

As a Software Engineer, you‚Äôll play a key role in designing, scaling, and evolving our learning platform. You‚Äôll:


  • Design and develop our online platform for DISC assessments, simulations, and training resources.
  • Work across the full stack‚Äîfrom engaging UIs to robust APIs .
  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and engineering teams.
  • Integrate features for DISC assessment delivery and visualization.
  • Build systems to deliver learning content and track progress.
  • Architect AI-powered simulations for real-world collaboration practice.
  • Write testable, well-documented code, and participate in code reviews.
  • Improve and operate our Kubernetes-based infrastructure.
  • Monitor system health and respond proactively.
  • Work with LLM APIs to deliver personalized, AI-assisted guidance.


What you bring

We're looking for someone who is both technical and mission-driven , with:


  • Proficiency in React , Shadcn UI , and Redux Toolkit .
  • Strong backend skills in Python/FastAPI and Go .
  • Experience with PostgreSQL (or similar relational DBs).
  • Comfort working with prompting/fine-tuning LLMs .
  • Solid grasp of software engineering best practices.
  • Great problem-solving and communication skills.
  • Ability to work independently in a collaborative team.


Bonus points

  • Experience with LMS platforms or online education tools.
  • Familiarity with authoring systems and access control.
  • Data visualization experience.
  • Contributions to open-source projects.
  • A genuine passion for education, teamwork, and continuous learning.


What we offer

  • Mission-driven work with real-world impact.
  • Growth at the intersection of AI and education .
  • A modern, high-leverage tech stack with space for creativity.
  • A curious, supportive, and diverse team.


Ready to soar?

If you're excited about building the future of collaborative learning and want to empower individuals and teams to thrive together, we want to hear from you !


Send your resume and a short cover letter to:

What you will do

As a Software Engineer, you‚Äôll play a key role in designing, scaling, and evolving our learning platform. You‚Äôll:


  • Design and develop our online platform for DISC assessments, simulations, and training resources.

  • Collaborate closely with product, design, and engineering teams.
  • Integrate features for DISC assessment delivery and visualization.
  • Build systems to deliver learning content and track progress.
  • Architect AI-powered simulations for real-world collaboration practice.
  • Write testable, well-documented code, and participate in code reviews.
  • Improve and operate our Kubernetes-based infrastructure.
  • Monitor system health and respond proactively.
  • Work with LLM APIs to deliver personalized, AI-assisted guidance.


What you bring

We're looking for someone who is both technical and mission-driven , with:


  • Proficiency in React , Shadcn UI , and Redux Toolkit .

  • Great problem-solving and communication skills.

Bonus points

  • Contributions to open-source projects.
  • A genuine passion for education, teamwork, and continuous learning.

title: Senior PPC Campaign Manager
description:
We‚Äôre Hiring: Google Ads Expert (Remote | U.S. Market | Home Improvement Niche)

We are a results-driven digital marketing agency looking for an experienced Google Ads specialist to join our remote team .

If you have a strong track record generating leads in the U.S. Home Improvement space (roofing, remodeling, HVAC, etc.) ‚Äì we‚Äôd love to connect.

Role Overview:
  • Position : Google Ads Expert
  • Location : Remote
  • Niche : Home Improvement (U.S. market)
  • Type : Freelance / Part-time, with growth potential
What We're Looking For:
  • Minimum 3 years of experience managing Google Ads campaigns (Search, Display, YouTube, Performance Max)
  • Proven success in lead generation for U.S.-based clients in the home services sector
  • Strong analytical skills and familiarity with conversion tracking, A/B testing, audience targeting, and bidding strategies
  • Experience in ad copywriting and funnel optimization
  • Excellent communication skills, self-discipline, and accountability
Responsibilities:
  • Plan, launch, and manage ad campaigns for U.S. home service clients
  • Analyze and optimize performance based on KPIs (CPL, ROAS, lead quality)
  • Collaborate with our internal creative and strategy team
  • Provide clear reporting and performance insights
To Apply:

Please send:

  • Your resume or LinkedIn profile
  • Campaign portfolio or performance screenshots
  • A short message highlighting your experience with U.S. home improvement campaigns
